Reviews.Title: “Nice conference location”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedForeigner
Reviews.Content: I was here for a 3-day conference. Inner Harbor was more bustling than I expected. Proximity to the piers offered a nice quick breaks from key notes and track sessions. Our group also got on a dinner cruise which embarked right across the street from the hotel. All in all a very convenient location. My room was spacious with a room-width sofa by the window. The best part of the room was the view of the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls is not an understatement”
Reviews.Author: goob007
Reviews.Content: Don't bother learning how to use the remote as you will be listening to the neighbors TV most of the time anyway, or if they come in at 2am you will be treated to door slamming up and down the hall. Nap in the afternoon, fugal such luck as housekeeping yelling up and down the hall to chat while they go in and out of rooms........ Agree with bathrooms very small and a bit dated..... On an up note staff very nice and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location on Inner Harbor, five minutes to walk to Camden Yards..”
Reviews.Author: pickychrissy
Reviews.Content: Pricelined this hotel for half the price per night on easter weekend.in town for yankees game....front desk amazing service, rooms spotless, happy hour at bar with terrific bartender, double beds fit adult & 14 yr old, other bed adult & 11 yr old ..both boys...super comfy..location is prime..super safe walk to night game t camden yards...walked from little italy ti hyatt at night, too..about 12 min eating gelato from vaccaro's ...dont miss happy hour at la scala...do water taxi & go to fells point for crab cakes....self parking $27/ night but parking lot around xorner is probably cheaper..highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “This was a Gem”
Reviews.Author: cadman_foster
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend at the Hyatt Regency Baltimore with my girlfriend to see the sites and catch a show and I can honestly say that this was one of the best hotel stays I’ve ever experienced. From the Keith the head valet to Melvin the bellhop to the front desk staff, everyone was extremely courteous, professional and helpful. Check in was seamless. The room was very nice and clean (definitely request a harbor view). One especially nice touch was the ultra modern bathroom with a glass shower big enough for two (oolala!) The hotel is accessible via an above street walkway to the Harbor as well as the Convention Center. We were at the epicenter of everything in downtown Baltimore so all the restaurants at the harbor, Convention center, Camden Yards and the Aquarium are all within walking distance. Nothing was more than a 10-15 minute walk. We took in a show at 1st Mariners and it was a $4.00 cab ride. Check out was quick via a invoice that I was emailed with barcode to scan at a kiosk. The whole process to about 3 minutes. In the morning on the way out I highly recommend the pineapple fiz in the lobby. All in all this was an excellent top tier experience. Ok if I had to say anything bad about the stay was that I was kind of shocked by the prices at the gift shop (I paid $11 for 2 bottles of water) but I suppose that’s to be expected. Anything you need is a 10 minute walk over to the harbor. But this did nothing to diminish my stay

Reviews.Title: “Regency Club needs improvement but customer service is top notch”
Reviews.Author: kwondogg
Reviews.Content: My family (myself, my wife, and a 14 month old baby) decided to stay at the Hyatt for one night to sightsee. Overall, this was a very good stay. The location can't be beat (walking distance to the Aquarium, Port Discovery, restaurants, etc) and the hotel itself was very clean. All the staff were very friendly and said "hi" to us in the halls or wherever we ran into any of them. I shelled out a little more to get the Regency Club perks. We were first placed on the Regency Club floor (12th floor) in room 1220. Being a Platinum Hyatt member, they gave us a great harbor view room. Unfortunately, there were frat guys next door who were wrestling (sounded like they were throwing eachother off the walls) and loud music playing so we I had to call the front desk and asked to be moved. They moved us right away to the other side of the hotel (room 1230) and although it wasn't the harbor view, it was MUCH quieter, which was good for our baby who needs his naps in the room. I asked for a pack n play but one wasn't there so I called the front desk again and they brought it up instantly. Great service. The only glitch on our stay was our disappointment with the Regency Club. At check-in, I was given a paper with all the perks of the Club and what times the drinks were being served, etc, but when I had gone in there in the afternoon and early evening for a quick finger food bite, most of the food was not replenished and there was barely anything to eat. The drinks were supposedly being served (cash bar) between 8pm-9pm and I walked in at 8:30pm to grab a beer and noted that there was no one there. I waited around until 9pm but ended up leaving to grab a bite and a drink downstairs at the Bistro 300 restaurant (which by the way, the bar tender was excellent). The following morning we went into the Regency Club lounge for breakfast and it was pretty decent. There was someone there to refill the food and it was also nice having access to free bottled water and soda at anytime we want. Was the lounge as great as advertised? No, it definitely needs improvement, but overall, it was satisfactory. So even with the slight glitch of the Regency Club, why did I give it 5 stars? Well, couple of days after we got back from our stay, I got an email asking for a feedback/survey of our stay. I said pretty much the same thing about the Regency Club and a day later, I got a personal email from the Hyatt management apologizing and awarded me bonus 5,000 points on my Goldpass. Now that's customer service and a true reflection of Hyatt standards. I don't even care about the points. Just the fact that someone took the time to write me a personal email apologizing, that would've still been good enough to get 5 stars in my book. The points, I'll use it right back at another Hyatt this summer for our stays, so it doesn't matter, but it's little things like this is what separates Hyatt from other hotels. It made me feel very proud to be a Hyatt Platinum member and will definitely be back to this hotel very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: auburn8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel this weekend while attending a conference at the hotel. We absolutely loved the location, between the shopping, restaurants, aquarium and other sights of the Inner Harbor and Camden Yards. This hotel is typical of the quality I expect from the Hyatt Regency chain. Even though we arrived late check-in was a pleasant experience. The late night staff were very friendly and sped us through the process efficiently. Our room was decently sized and had a modest view of the harbor and of Federal Hill. The TV was a nice sized flat screen. There were plenty of electrical outlets conveniently placed for charging phones and lap tops. The bed was quite comfortable with a nice selection of pillows. Temperature control was a little uneven but was acceptable. The bath room only had a shower which might be a little disconcerting for people who like a bath but it was large and worked very well. The toilet's handle can only be reached if you put the lid down and that is somewhat awkward. Also, when we brushed our teeth our first night the drain plug in the sink was shut. The lever to unplug it is very small and is located at the back, bottom of the spigot where it is very difficult to find. Another thing that was a little annoying was that they ask us to be "green" and reuse our towels but there is only one small place to hang a towel up. They have a very nice fitness center and a roof top pool that was not yet open for the season. The lobby area, the meeting rooms, and the restaurant are all quite nice. I was also very impressed with the quality of the staff. Overall, this is a very nice property, is well staffed, and is in a super location.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: kathryn031
Reviews.Content: Nice venue for a conference. Meeting spaces were typically over crowded for our group, however. The interior glass elevator ride was a nice way to view the harbor on the way to and from my room and the meetings. The skywalk to the inner harbor made a pleasurable connection to that area directly from the hotel. Nice area for a walk or dining alfresco from a takeout place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice when in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: annyong1
Reviews.Content: I booked here last minute through Priceline so I can't comment on the value of a full price room, but for a discount it's great. Nice room with floor to ceiling window views. Comfortable bedding and a great shower. The staff was really helpful during our late check-in and very understanding when we forgot about the time change in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomadations + First rate staff = Exellent”
Reviews.Author: ezevans
Reviews.Content: We came into Baltimore on 2/17 to catch Bonerama (a great New Orleans band) at the 8x10 Club with some friends. Doing the late night drive back to Fredericksburg after the show seemed crazy to us so we booked a room at the Hyatt Regency. Everything about our stay was just a positive experience, beginning with Mr. Taylor at the front desk. He was courteous, professional, had great wit and a winning smile. We threw him a couple curve balls (i.e., room request and credit card requirements) and he handled each one perfectly. When asked if we could speak to the manager on duty, he made it clear that it was in no way an issue and he would be glad to assist. The manager was equally as professional answering all questions!!! As a side note, our conversation with the manager was not the result of any problem in terms of our reservation. Room was great. We stayed in a Respire room which is a hypo-allergenic room. Wow, what a difference that made. I have allergies and typically find myself waking up congested and tired when I stay at a hotel. This time when I woke up I didn't have the need to hop into a steaming shower just to breath. The bed was comfortable, room was spotless, and I loved the bathroom design. I would say it was about average size with plenty of storage area/cabinets and a work area. All electronics/lights/temperature control/Wi-Fi were in working order. Although the hotel has many really cool features, the glass elevator was awesome. You can look out over the Inner Harbor and at night it is pretty spectacular!! As an FYI, parking is not free to hotel guest (we knew that). I believe it was either $28 or $32 for the evening. Poor planning on our part as we came in separate vehicles. Just something travelers may want to plan for if on a budget. I will absolutely be staying at the Hyatt on my next trip to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: ShadowWalker156
Reviews.Content: Overall, a great stay. Some water pressure issues in the bathroom, but not enough to detract from the overall comfort of the stay. It is a great location with the Inner Harbor just across the street. The offered web check-in was nice and my room was ready when I arrived at 7:30AM, another huge plus that allowed me to drop my bags off and relax for a few minutes before moving on to an all-day meeting. The room offered enough space for me to do the work that I needed to do in the evening. The wi-fi speeds on the standard level were fine for my work needs. Overall, if needing to stay in Baltimore, I would most definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Third stay, always good, no issues, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: emstraveler349
Reviews.Content: Stayed here again for business recently, the rooms were quite large (King Bed) with all the basic amenities. Internet is addtitional cost. Right across from the inner harbor. Staff was helpful at the front desk, parking pretty inexpensive or comparable to the area so no issues there. I continue to stay there because of the service and room quality and location and would stay again! Thanks

Reviews.Title: “5 star location and service, 3 star rooms”
Reviews.Author: gumbo8771
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights while visiting our daughter who goes to college in Baltimore. Have stayed in the Inner Harbor several times before...at Hotel Monaco, Rennaissance, Marriott and others so not a novice in this area. I'll start with the good points. Parking is convenient, can do valet or self-park right next door (get a pass when checking in and can come/go as you please, daily rate charged to room). Unfortunately doesn't connect directly to hotel so have to go outside to get in the hotel, but not too bad so long as your not carrying a lot. Lobby and lounge/fitness etc is very nice. Pool is outside so closed during cold months. Location is fabulous and can take outdoor skywalk directly to Inner Harbor shops. Stayed on 8th floor facing harbor and views were fantastic. Service was top notch and everybody I dealt with was friendly and asking to help you. We especially would like to commend Jeremy at the Concierge, I'd highly recommend taking advantage of his expertise and connections... he hooked us up with a great place to eat and a great reservation in Fells Point. Now the bad...the room/bathroom isn't anything special. It looks like it's stuck in the 70's. I found the beds to be kinda hard, cold and uncomfortable and the toilet had a handle flush like you'd see in a public restroom...not a Hyatt! And...the worst thing about the rooms...noisy. If you are a light sleeper you better hope they didn't put you next to anybody that is a night owl or there is a lot going on downtown that night. I'm not a light sleeper, yet I was still awaken when the people next door came in late and proceeded to continue the merryment in bed...oh yes...I found it pretty funny but if this sort of thing isn't amusing to you beware. Overall, I'd stay there again just based on the location and service...but beware the rooms aren't anything great.

Reviews.Title: “Great views of the Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: ExploringtheEarth
Reviews.Content: This hotel has fantastic floor to ceiling windows in the rooms---obviously you want a room with a view of the Inner Harbor. We had a great one night stay. Staff are very pleasant and professional. Only one thing to beware of....the walls are paper thin. Television noise and bathroom noise from adjacent rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...not great either.”
Reviews.Author: ERat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Regency Baltimore for two nights while attending a conference. It's a very nice hotel. The location was perfect. The only gripes I have are: the room had a terrible view. When I opened the curtains there was a concrete wall and one of the elevators. No harbor or city view. I had a wall view. There was a huge stain on the carpet that needs to be addressed by housekeeping. The elevators can also be a little slow. The positives were: Nice size rooms. Bed was comfortable. Room temp was easy to control. The waterfront location was great. The conference facilities we OK. Overall, the Hyatt is a very acceptable choice when staying in Baltimore. It's not the best place in town, but it pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, but a tough night's sleep!”
Reviews.Author: kttenn
Reviews.Content: First, the staff is wonderful. Whomever is in charge is doing a great job motivating his or her staff, from the bellhops to the concierge. I've been very impressed. However, this hotel is loud! I am on the seventh floor, harbor side. The view is great, but all I hear are the tvs in the rooms around me, slamming doors and sirens from outside. The walls are so thin, I found myself lowering my voice on the phone because I thought my neighbors may hear me. The room service is lousy and overpriced and the bed linens are stiff. I wish they'd put the same passion they've shown in customer service into improving the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: newlynewlywed2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed here 2 weekends ago. We are from Baltimore and know the area well and thought it was in a prime location. The hotel itself is beautiful. The rooms were very modern and spotless clean. The hotel is right across the bridge to Harbor Place and within walking distance to Power Plant. The normal rates run a bit high, but we snagged a deal on hotels.com for about half the price. Would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone visitng Baltimore!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Evelyn D
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency was in a great location. You could get to the Inner Harbor through a bridge without having to deal with traffic. The staff was wonderful, especially Melvin in the concierge service. The breakfast was nice in Bistro 300, especially since it was included in the AAA deal that we had. Parking was convenient, although the parking card had to be replace once. The room - on the 9th floor with a view of the convention center - was very nice; however, you could feel the cold through the corner window.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right near the Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: Fishie123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on a weekday through Priceline and had no problems getting a king size bed with a gorgeous view of the harbor. Didn't use any of the amenities this time around, but I'd stay here again especially for the deal that I got. Close to everything, and right across the street from Harborplace. Steps away from the orange line of the Charm City Circulator.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tj722
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay in if you want to be right next to the attractions of the Inner Harbor. It's also a quick cab ride away from other closer neighborhoods like Mount Vernon. As for the hotel itself, the property was in great shape. I got a room that did not face the harbor but I didn't push it since it was a huge corner room - and it was a Priceline win. The view wasn't stellar but it was literally a wall of windows. A bit drafty, but it was still nice. The staff was very pleasant, no complaints there. Parking wasn't cheap as others have noted. All in all, a fine stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey55
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times to see shows or sporting events in Baltimore. Very satisfied. Mostly found good rates on Hotwire or Priceline. Not always best rooms or views since booked on discount sites but I am not there to hang in the hotel. Hotel key does not always work in the elevator and our room was a little worn but overall the staff is friendly and the hotel is attractive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, otherwise solid but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: mattreider
Reviews.Content: Let's face it, if you're headed to Baltimore for a quick weekend, you probably want to see the Inner Harbor and an Orioles game at the yard. This is a great place for both. Rooms are good, beds are comfortable. The parking is expensive, so expect that.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of the bay”
Reviews.Author: owen1604
Reviews.Content: Wow, this is a dream place to stay if you are travelling to Baltimore for business or pleasure. Situated in the heart of Baltimore, it has a beautiful view of the inner harbor. If you are travelling for business, they have great facilities for conferences as well as access to nearby convention centers. No need to mention that the staff are courteous and the rooms clean. Conveniently located near to some great restaurants as well as the national aquarium.

Reviews.Title: “Great Prices, great location”
Reviews.Author: Krissy1983
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here for the third time this year for business. The hotel is in a great location - it's very easy to get here and the location is perfect for out-of-towners. If you want restaurants or tourist destinations there are a ton within walking distance, and a skywalk into the inner harbor. The hotel was clean and well taken care of and the staff was extremely nice, helpful and accommodating. I had a great view of the inner harbor, too.

Reviews.Title: “Devil is in the details...”
Reviews.Author: nappieb
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twelve times over the past nine years so I consider myself to be well qualified to express an opinion. I hasten to add that my visits were on business and NOT by choice! Generally this hotel displays standard Hyatt fare, but gets a failing grade in its lack of attention to simple details. For example: Batteries almost flat in the TV remote control (on at least half of my visits). Charges for use of the business center facilities (regular followers of my reviews will know this is a pet peeve of mine!) Consistently substandard room service food, despite a fairly good selection. Room service wait times vary widely from their promised time of delivery. Bar and lounge confusingly placed on a mezzanine between the second and third floors - it lacks atmosphere and the service is deplorable (they've FINALLY taken steps to improve the service here but more work is needed just to attain an "average" level of service.) A map of the hotel's access to the Inner Harbor attractions would be nice - the hotel has walkways to facilitate access to pedestrian areas, but these walkways are difficult to find and most guests don't even know they exist! The hotel has one small store where incidentals, souvenirs and general travel accessories are sold. An hotel of this size and stature (?) should offer more than this one small store. If you're attending a meeting, you'll always have a long walk to the bathroom from the meeting room! Bad planning! Perhaps it's just me, but I've NEVER enjoyed a good night's sleep at this hotel!! There are better hotels for both business and pleasure in this area!

Reviews.Title: “Great Views!”
Reviews.Author: ROBnVA
Reviews.Content: Try to get a room on an upper floor with a full harbor view. Amazing! Restaurant is pricey. Very limited menu was offered for dinner the Sat. after Thanksgiving. Head across the street to the harbor and surrounding streets for a more satisfying/reasonably priced meal. Breakfast at Miss Shirley's is not to be missed. No seal at the bottom of the shower door caused some minor flooding. Put a spare towel down in front of it beforehand. Staff were very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Views of the Inner Harbor not to be missed”
Reviews.Author: venus1kjs
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Hyatt several times a year to have a home base when frequenting Fells Point, Canton and Mount Vernon attractions. They have a top notch staff, very attendant valets and a great breakfast in their restaurant. We usually book on priceline via name your own price with a 4 star hotel. We tend to get the Hyatt or the Marriott Waterfront, both are highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “debunu”
Reviews.Author: debunu
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice. I loved the glass elevator with the view of the Harbor. The hotel was so convenient to shopping and the Harbor. We normally stay at the Renaissance Hotel across the street but we got a better rate ($143) at the Hyatt by booking online and using my AAA- it included parking ($27) and breakfast buffet everyday at Bistro 300. The staff was extremely helpful and nice. We look forward to going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, great location, clean”
Reviews.Author: gypsy41
Reviews.Content: We wanted to go to the B+O Railroad Museum with our children last minute and found the Hyatt Regency. It was our first time to Baltimore in a long time. The hotel has an elevated walkway over to the Inner Harbor, It was about 1 mile from the museum. The rooms were clean and well lit (i hate dark hotel rooms), the beds very comfortable. We asked and got adjoining rooms and housekeeping was up to open up the doors within 5 minutes even though we checked in late at night. We got a great deal with AAA with a breakfast buffet and in and out parking all day, for only $145. My kids loved riding the elevators with a grand view of the atrium and the harbor, and seeing Christmas decorations. The breakfast buffet was great, big variety, and generally good food. My kids enjoyed that as well. The bistro is surrounded on one side by a nice water/sculpture/mural display. the staff were quite nice. It does not have an indoor pool. we didn't have time to check out the gym. The aquarium is just on the other side of the harbor. it was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good & Bad”
Reviews.Author: weins4
Reviews.Content: First the good- you cannot beat the location. It is perfect for any visit to the Inner harbor, Aquarium and Science Center. We had a corner room on the 11th floor overlooking the harbor. It was nicely updated and very spacious. The staff was extremely helpful and very nice. Also, we got a GREAT deal- $159 including parking ($26) and 2 tickets to the Aquarium. Now the not so nice- our room was never cleaned on our third day and when I requested turn down service so we can get fresh towels, they never came. Perks coffee shop was never open. Lastly, the parking swipe card for the garage never worked. We had to keep getting an attendant or getting a new card to go in and out of the garage.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Nice”
Reviews.Author: aps_march
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and very conveniently located. It is easy to take the light rail from the airport to the hotel. The hotel is attached to the convention center and is very close to the harbor and the various attractions there.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice, not great location”
Reviews.Author: hailahh
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days at a conference in the Hyatt Regency "Inner Harbor" in Baltimore. Since most of my time was spent in the hotel (meals were provided mostly) it was a pretty good experience. The food provided by catering was great, the internet in the conference rooms worked, the elevators were swift. The few times I went outside, I wasn't thrilled about the atmosphere of that end of Baltimore. There was a "harborfront" sort of development with shops and restaurants, reachable via a bridge, but there didn't seem to be much life to it. The occupy movement had folks in tents in the little park nearby, that was interesting but since I only went out late at night I didn't really try to interact with them. There were a number of homeless people around, maybe because of this...

Reviews.Title: “Has seen better days”
Reviews.Author: MrsMcG726
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd or 3rd stay at this hotel over the last 5 years. It has slowly deteriorated and is in need of some sprucing. My room was clean and decorated as standard but the two full beds (they didn't seem like queens) could definitely use some new linens. I was on the 6th floor and some evenings there seemed to be some employees using a service type room near by, which was quite loud. I also thought that the hallway carpets seemed "tired". The gym was clean, air conditioned and had a great variety of equipment plus a basket of fresh fruit available. We were in town as exhibitiors at an event being held at the convention center. It is a quick walk. We had breakfast at the cafeteria inside the Bank of America building several times - this was probably the best part of our trip - it was inexpensive and freshly cooked. The hotel is conveniently located to the Gallery of shops and the inner harbor. I personally think that it doesn't seem safe to walk around by yourself at night, but others may disagree. I went to the Gallery one evening and hustled back to the hotel because there were lots of people milling about because of the Wall Street protests. I am traveling to Baltimore again in May for another convention and we are going to try a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale, Convenient, Great for Harbor Walks but kind of noisy”
Reviews.Author: JoeMiner
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right between the Convention Center and the Harbor. There is a short walk to lots of restaurants and bars around the harbor. It's right by the USS Constellation and the harbor water taxi. The staff here is great. My only real complaint is with the architect who selected doors that don't seal and that close LOUDLY. We kept getting woken up by the banging and our connecting room had not much sound insulation so we could clearly hear what was going on next door (and I'm sure vice-versa). I would try to close a door quietly but by design it has a loud latching noise that is unavoidable. This diminished the quality of the stay quite a bit and is the reason I didn't rate the hotel much higher. Watch out for the cost of internet access. They sell two speeds and the $10/night is kind of slow, the $30/night was a little pricey for my actual needs. The drinks at the bar are kind of pricey too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hyatt, just needs more rrstaurants”
Reviews.Author: Michael A
Reviews.Content: Exactly what you'd expect from a Hyatt; great staff, great room, and fantastic location, but with only one restaurant with a limited menu, you are forced to dine outside. This probably was no big deal a couple of years ago since it is so close to the Inner Harbor but with many venues closing there, having a nice meal is a bit of a chore.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location.....Location”
Reviews.Author: StrandedCurbside
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Hyatt Regency in Baltimore to attend a conference at the Baltimore Convention Center. The Hyatt Hotel is conveniently located to Baltimore's Inner Harbor with Skywalks (over roadways) connecting its guests safely to either the inner Harbor area or to the Convention Center. The hotel conveniently has a parking garage located next door with Valet Service or Self parking available. Had a partial water view of the harbor which was nice, but a room with a full view of the Baltimore harbor would have been the best situation to enjoy - especially the view of the City at night. The hotel had a very nice Concierge Lounge available to qualified guests providing them 24-hour access for beverages and snacks, appetizers in the evening with wine and beer for a fee, and a extensive variety of breakfast food that surpasses any continental breakfast one could want. Great place to stay !

Reviews.Title: “Harbor style”
Reviews.Author: urban_kowboy
Reviews.Content: We were here for the inaugural Baltimore Grand Prix. This hotel was located inside the tracks so access to and from was limited between 7am and 7pm. Since this was a very unique situation, I can't hold judgement against Hyatt for the inconvenience. But maybe someone reading this will benefit from my experience if they plan on attending this event the next time. I chose to have a room with a view of the track but had to pay $50 extra. Considering that I was able to book this room on the day the festivities started, I wasn't complaining. So keep that in mind that hotel rooms inside the track do not sell out as fast as you think. I like the lobby and access to the Baltimore Harbor. Parking is pretty expensive but there are cheaper options within a few blocks. The room was decent and the staff was helpful. I did not eat anything the hotel served so I can't comment on that. Especially since there are awesome dining options in the surrounding areas. It's real good on normal operating days but for the Grand Prix, I advise you to plan ahead and don't drive there. Between parking prices and all the streets that were cut-off, it wasn't worth it. But overall, the hotel is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: portfolioflyer
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Baltimore is a nice hotel. It's not the best I've ever stayed at, and it's not the worst. If I had to compare this against all the other hotels I've stayed at, it would be in the 75th percentile. The location is fantastic. I was in town for a week long meeting at the nearby Hilton. The Hyatt is connected to the Sheraton, the Baltimore Convention Center, and the Hilton. It was extremely convenient to walk indoors the whole time when it was raining. As for Bistro 300, it's nothing to write home about. I've sampled a lot of their food and nothing really stood out (especially at the price). The interior is quite dated. Overall, stay at the Hyatt for the location, skip the restaurant and you'll have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST STAFF EVER”
Reviews.Author: TLSantoro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt last year this time for my wedding with all my family and friends. While waiting for my wedding brunch (one year ago today), my father suddenly collapsed in the lobby and passed the following day. I cannot express the gratitude our family holds towards the staff of the Hyatt, Jessie, being one that strongly stands out. They were not only fantastic when it came to accommodating us for the wedding, but they went above and beyond when it came to compassion and understanding with my fathers death and were there if we needed something while we were making arrangements of getting my father upstate and grieving (to the extent that in a fully booked hotel they always ensured my mother had a room facing the harbor so she would have that a beautiful view). A year later, it still makes me comforted to think of the staff and the amount of compassion they offered. THANK YOU SO MUCH! (and it was in September of 2010, but trip advisor won't let me go back one more month).

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, Excellent Service, Large Rooms on the Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: Robert B
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times and it has never disappointed. Meals are expensive here & without a deal the rooms are too. I stayed with a negotiated conference rate that was very reasonable. The food has always been very good but pricey. The service has always been excellent. Be sure to figure in the cost of parking and I recommend at lot next door that is almost reasonable. There is an overhead walk to the festival marketplace at Inner Harbor and the environment seems safe. Be careful of the free internet in the lobby because I spoke to several he said they believed there Facebook account was hacked from there. My room did not have much of a view but most of the rooms have excellent views. There are great restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynnealbright
Reviews.Content: We are staying here as I type this review. 2 nights, king harborview room.We would not normally spend this much on a hotel but it is our 20th anniversary and my hubbys birthday. Check in was a breeze with the self checkin kiosks. The room is nice, nothing out of the ordinary. You are paying for the view, which is great!!. We had a problem last night with the room next door blaring their TV to late hours so we called the front desk and they sent security up and it got quiet. The hotel gave us a voucher with a list of things to choose from for our inconvenience. I thought that was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice for the Inner Harbor!”
Reviews.Author: Kristine_LongIsland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were visiting Baltimore for one night. After looking at several hotels, we chose the Hyatt Regency because of it's location to both the Inner Harbor and Camden Yards. We are so happy we chose this hotel. It was about $30 more when compared to other hotels, but it was definitely worth the extra money. It is conveniently located only a few blocks from I-95 so you don't have to worry about getting lost in the city! We arrived on a Friday morning in August at around 10:30 a.m. and used the self-parking. We were greeted at the front door by the bellman who opened the door for us. There was no line at the front desk and we were greeted by Adam. He was very helpful and friendly. We were able to check-in immediately. Adam also charged the parking ($27...this seemed to be the same at other hotels) to our room so we could avoid the self-service machines. We were on the 14th floor and were given a corner room. This room was significantly larger than the other rooms. However, we didn't have a view of the harbor. No big deal, we weren't in the room that long anyway. The room had a desk/chair, table/chairs, a chaise lounge, mini-bar and big flat screen t.v. The bed was comfy and air-conditioning worked well. The bathroom was small, but served its' purpose. There were floor-to-ceiling windows, but as I said, no view of the harbor. There is one casual restaurant on-site which is open for breakfast. In the afternoon, the bar opens and then the restaurant re-opens for dinner. There is a small place to grab coffee and a bagel/croissant/muffin, etc... for a quick breakfast. There is also a small gift shop located next to the coffee place. The best part about this hotel is the location. If you walk out the side doors on the second floor, you can take the Skywalk right over to the Inner Harbor. There was even security stationed on the walkway at night so it was safe at any time of day. Camden Yards is only a few blocks away and very easy to walk to. We really enjoyed visiting Baltimore and wished we could have stayed longer as there is so much to do. We definitely plan to return to Baltimore and would without a doubt, choose the Hyatt Regency. The staff was friendly. The hotel was clean. The room was nice. Definitely a perfect location for a trip to Baltimore's Inner Harbor!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: steph943
Reviews.Content: I stay at a lot of Hyatt properties and was somewhat disappointed with this one. The location is great if you are attending a baseball or football game or if you want to stroll the inner harbor area. The bellhop service was very friendly and helpful. Had a long wait at check in, while the employee was flirting with the guest in front of me... but hey if it's true love, you gotta do what you gotta do! The rooms, however, seemed a bit dated. We were told that the first several floors were being renovated. The property could definitely use it. Got a tip from one of the bellhops for a bite to eat... Kona Grill around the corner (tasty fish tacos). If I were to travel back to the area, I would only stay at this hotel if the renovations were complete.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to visit Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: chaplo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Spring break, and found this hotel ideally located, clean and quiet. We had a beautiful view of the harbor. Room came with two doubles and a chaise lounge, perfect size for my 6 year old. Quick walk to Science museum, Aquarium, Camden Yards,, Sports Museum, Babe Ruth Birthplace. Would definitely stay here again. Kids loved the glass enclosed elevator and the breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, easy to get to, close to ballparks and Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: scotdon
Reviews.Content: Got my reservation on Hotwire for a very good price. Right across from Inner Harbor, Next to Baltimore Convention Center, and about 3-4 blocks from Both the Football and Baseball stadiums. Was able to scalp first row seat next to first base for $25. Iknow it's the O's but it was still fun. I travel about 75 nights per year, and this is a very nice hotel. Very comfortable beds, ipod docking station, and very easy to get to from I-95. Only negative is $27 self Park and over $30 for Valet

Reviews.Title: “On Inner Harbor, but not much else”
Reviews.Author: HersheyFamilyTravel
Reviews.Content: Travelled alone for business, - nice to have an "over the road" walkway to inner harbor - OK room (6th floor), but not the cleanest - service average, but they were dealing with hurricaine irene prep - weak outside pool - scary hot tub in suboptimal workout room

Reviews.Title: “I expected better...”
Reviews.Author: AndreaVB
Reviews.Content: Very, very noisy on a Saturday night. The atrium/lobby is open to the rooms and the sound travels. Keep this in mind if you are staying during a convention and ask for a room away from the balcony. Another problem was the long waits for the elevators; I don't know if this was a temporary issue or not, but I eventually gave up and used the stairs. Overall, my stay was average at best.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent front desk; avoid restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Lee59
Reviews.Content: The front desk and concierge staff were quite friendly, and were also very helpful with locating nearby restaurants. We arrived around 10pm, and were told that the restaurant (Bistro 300) was open until midnight. That was quite a nice surprise - until we went there. We arrived at the restaurant at roughly 10:30. The service was unbelievably slow. After quite some time a waiter took our order. Fifteen minutes later, we managed to get a bus-girl to give us some water. Drinks took almost a half-hour from time-of-arrival. The sandwiches took at least 45 minutes. Breakfast at Bistro 300 was a little better, but nothing to write home about. The room was reasonable, but below traditional Hyatt standards. There were hairs on the counter, and a couple in the shower. The bedding was not great. There is a coffee shop in the lobby, but it closes at noon! Also, the elevators advertise a top-floor restaurant with great views. We went up there on a Thursday night, but the place was apparently abandoned - strange. Lastly, my partner slipped on some greasy patch by the pool, and got some nasty scrapes.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Shannon T
Reviews.Content: I chose the Hyatt in Baltimore because it was the only hotel with a pool and it has a great location but I was pleasantly surprised with my overall impression of the hotel. The rooms were nice and clean, the food was good and the staff was incredible! Everyone was super friendly from the front desk staff to the parking attendant to Doug in the Club Lounge. I thought this was a "conference hotel" but it was much more. My husband I had a great time and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but really noisy”
Reviews.Author: aaatravelgal25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt when we were in town to attend a baseball game at Camden Yards. The location is perfect-within easy walking distance to the stadium and to the Inner Harbor. Some of the hotels closer to Camden Yards would have been a bit of a distance to the Harbor, so this was perfect for doing both. This was our third time at the hotel, but the first that was not a business trip. No matter how you look at it, this is a really busy hotel. Check in went smoothly since we could use the Gold Passport line, however, I noticed the "regluar" line was slow. Our room was clean and fine for one night, but a little worn (scuff marks on the baseboard and furniture, bathroom faucets leaky) and our bathroom had a big shower but no tub. Our main complaint was the noise. From the main lobby, to the elevators and especially in the rooms, this is a noisy hotel. We could hear people talking in the room next to us very clearly, and sound in the corridor and the rooms above was also noticeable. There are signs everywhere (in the lobby and on the table outside the elevators on each floor) asking guests to be quiet at night, so this is obviously an issue for the hotel. Bottom line, if you're looking for a clean hotel in a great location and don't mind the noise and bustling activity, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Super service and enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: PRimage
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency in Baltimore for a week-long business trip earlier this month and was very impressed with its amenities and great central location. I was especially impressed with the excellent and friendly service from all the staff. They go out of their way to be helpful and welcoming. In particular, the front desk staff dealt with my queries promptly and efficently. Thank-you Adam! And thanks also to the charming and helfpful porter, James. I loved my corner room, with stunning harbour views and a light and airy atmosphere. During my stay the weather was in the high-90's - but I was always cool and comfortable in the room - and enjoyed the comfortable bed, with linen changed daily. I had several room service dinners - all good and delivered speedily and the buffet breakfast was delicious. I was able to visit the pool several times - and although small, the pool area had comfortable loungers. The well-stocked shop also came in very handy when I needed several items I'd forgotten to pack! With a busy work schedule, I really appreciated staying at such a comfortable and well-run hotel and I would absolutely recommend! I am coming over to the States and Baltimore on business again later next month - and so I am looking forward to booking another stay at the Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, helpful staff, great location near Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: edit_rrrr
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Baltimore Hyatt was (very nearly) everything I would want from a business hotel in a big city: the location was excellent, the view from my 12th-floor room was spectacular, the concierge-level services were quite good, and all staff members I encountered were helpful and cordial in the extreme. The beds were comfortable and the room was spotlessly clean. The room was large, all furnishings worked well and were aesthetically pleasing, and the bath area was just the right size. Perhaps if the internet services were free (though they were entirely reliable and fast), it would have been a perfect stay (well, and if some smoking rooms or a more comfortable smoking area outside had been available, but I know that is a personal preference that many do not share). Close enough! I'd stay there again any time I have occasion to visit Baltimore for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not the best Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: clherrick
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Baltimore is good but I've stand in better Hyatts. while they have done some renovations the hotel still feels a bit dated. obviously fake plants decorate the lobby. the food in the restaraunt is okay but won't dazzle. our room on the street side was noisy but had a great view. the service is very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vegasclint
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a meeting for a couple of nights, and we really enjoyed the location. 4-5 blocks to Camden Yards, across the street from the Inner Harbor and the water taxi that takes you to all kinds of places around the harbor. Staff was very nice; hotel was clean, and it seemed safe. The food in the restaurant was OK for lunch, but service was a bit slow. Breakfast buffet was good, but it was $18. There are other food choices for all meals in the Inner Harbor, though, and if you get a Harbor View Room, you will be very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Jessimv
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last night on a whim to Break up a trip home from the beach. The service was incredible, the bed was comfortable and the location was perfect. Will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good all around Hyatt property”
Reviews.Author: PTelan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property probably 15 times in the past 10 years and it is predictably consistent and good. The location on Inner Harbour is wonderful and it is a short walk to Camden Yards. Nothing truly spectacular about the place but it certainly beats staying at some of the downtown Baltimore hotels. The front desk staff is quite friendly. I think that the one thing that could be improved upon relates to the staff's knowledge of good local restaraunts. You will probably be better served doing your own research on the subject. Overall, I would give this a Good rating, somewhere in between the 3 and 4 bubble rating, let's say a 3.5

Reviews.Title: “Great location, needs updating”
Reviews.Author: islington3164
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a recent business trip to Baltimore. While the office I was visiting was far from central Baltimore, wanted to stay in the Inner Harbour area as I'd never been to the City. The hotel is extremely well located, within walking distance of just about anything you'd want to see in the Inner Harbour area. While everything was clean and staff was extremely courteous and helpful, the hotel had a worn out, tired look to it. I just recently visited a friend who was staying at a Hyatt in my home city and got the same impression. Don't know if there's a pattern there, but at least with the two I've visited recently, seems like Hyatts need some serious updating. Room was large, clean with a nice bathroom although I found the amenities a little thin. Walls were on the thin side---could hear conversation of family with kids next door. I hate adjoining room doors in any hotel room and my room had one but it was well secured. Given proximity to the National Aquarium, there seemed to be lots of families with lots of kids and the hallways were somewhat loud at times. Not the hotels fault, but perhaps they could have a quiet floor for those who are on work, rather than a pleasure trip. Also on the negative side----the coffee maker had missing parts. I didn't bother calling the front desk but this shouldn't happen at any hotel. The tv, while nice, big flat screen, was thin on channels, except for all types of ESPN channels you would ever want. Room service was excellent in both delivery time, service and quality of food. I booked through Priceline and paid $75 per night so absolutely no complaints as to price and overall, happy with the hotel. However, if I wasn't booking through Priceline, not sure I'd choose the Hyatt. There are many other hotels in the area which look a lot fresher.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing trip for our family”
Reviews.Author: Reese B
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before but this hotel was so amazing that I just had to. We stayed for 2 nights at the Hyatt Regency at Inner Harbor and got a "Harbor View" room. The staff made us feel like we were family. It is a safe, secure, clean and absolutely gorgeous hotel. We went with our 8 and 10 year old and they just loved it. Our view was breathtaking. There is a sky walk over the highway so you never have to even deal with crossing a street and with your room sitting above the buildings the view of the water and all the happenings is very clear. Street performers all day and into the evening that are free and perform for tips. High security all around so it is safe. Water taxi takes you all around. There are 3 different kids' museums within blocks and countless restaurants. A mall full of interesting shops is right next door. I had to pay a little more for this hotel but it was so worth it with the harbor view. Wait until you get in the elevator! I would do it all over! Count on spending more than what you are used to for area eating. It's an expensive location. And if you're on a budget, bring a little cooler to put left overs or snacks/drinks in. There is a fridge but it is stocked with hotel drinks and snacks. ($5.30 for a bottle of water!) Even if you just splurge and go overnight it is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: AngusNJ
Reviews.Content: Pretty ordinary hotel, but excellent location right across street from inner harbor. Rooms were clean and relatively modern. My room overlooked the top of a parking garage - some rooms overlook harbor. Has a small outdoor pool that our 3 yr old used. Main complaint is that there was a lot of noise coming through the door - could hear every word anyone in the hall said, as well as elevator noise and constant door slamming all night. But I got it for $100 a night on Hotwire so was still a good deal. Staff was very friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful room and view! Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: mcdede
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at the Baltimore Hyatt. Nea checked me in and gave me an absolutely stunning room with windows on three sides. I wished I could have stayed in my room the whole time! She also suggested I join the Hyatt's reward program to get free internet, which was very helpful since I was there for about a week. Jesse was the greatest from the bell staff, he was so friendly and helpful! He certainly is an asset to the Hyatt. Hotel was in a great location. I wasn't impressed with housekeeping so much though, I had specifically left a note asking the housekeeper to not change the towels (trying to save the environment one towel at a time) but on the fourth night of my stay I asked to have my sheets changed, and she didn't, so I asked again the next day and they still didn't get changed. It didn't make sense to me that on my last night I would finally have clean sheets. It doesn't appear that the hotel has a "green program". The environment is a big issue and hotels should be doing their part. I would really like to see the Hyatt adopt a program like that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, with treats, is their best asset”
Reviews.Author: PoppaBear2
Reviews.Content: This review will cover several topics: hotel, family activities, food, recommendations, for the inner harbor area. We stayed at this location due to attending a conference, so it was a mixed business and family trip. The hotel location is very good, direcetly accross from the inner harbor, with a secluded walkway over the expressway. We flew into BWI and took the light rail, which made it easy and cheap. At check-in, we had a delightful surprise > "homemade cookies". (I don't know if they were actually homemade, but they tasted like they were). We also discovered the Amtrak from the inner harbor to DC-Union Station, which was a good side trip to Capitol Hill. We also visited Ft. McHenry via water taxi > leave plenty of time to see the sights, take a tour, then return trip (ours was the last off the dock, and they were at capacity >>add another 45 min!). The location of the hotel is their best asset > rooms were good, baths were very good, meals were OK. We had a nice walk around the inner harbor and found an amazing restaurant > The Rusty Scupper. We visited them 3 times over the span of 3 days, and enjoyed the views, meals, and the very friendly waiter (ex-Navy, extra tall, fun with the kids, with great stories and recommendations). The fitness center was a fun visit for the kids: they have a unique upstairs sauna contained within the fitness room. One small drawback at the hotel was the Homecoming events held in the ballrooms downstairs coincided with our stay. It was crowded, noisey, and high schoolers Everywhere... To sum up: Great Location, Wonderful Treats, short walk to train station/ballpark/inner harbor/Ft. McHenry/etc; I would recommend this hotel for these reasons (plus the discounted rate did hurt either).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: StayCurious
Reviews.Content: We used to live in Baltimore and I was initially a little disappointed when I found out we were staying at the Hyatt because it used to be 'tired' when we lived there. What a surprise - we were tired from driving when we arrived and were greeted by Jazmin (sp?) at the front desk who swiftly told us she was giving us a corner room with two double beds and do we want a rollaway? (complimentary!) Then she gave our kids passes for free ice cream - this was a huge hit. The room was large, pleasant, clean and dramatic with floor-to-ceiling window walls which extended into the bathroom. The beds were comfortable. The location of the hotel is front and center at the Harbor. The common areas are minimal, but pleasant and comfortable and the rooftop pool is very nice. Another thing we noticed was the consistently friendly and service-oriented staff. We will definitely seek a stay in this Hyatt again!

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: aandb199
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel, great location for baltimore, you can walk right over the sky bridge and go to inner harbor restraunts and shops. It has a shop and nice size lobby. fun elevator, dinner at there restraunt on second level was good, nothing special. The room was a little small for my liking.

Reviews.Title: “FORGET THE TROUBLE.”
Reviews.Author: mistykitty
Reviews.Content: Recently we reserved a room on the hyatt web site and since we were Diamond members we used one of our suite upgrades. Arriving at we were give a suite on the sixth floor and the only view was a massive gravel roof. So much for status. . Initially we had asked for a harbor view but they pay no attention to requests and the room assigning person does not look at status or requests. After 1 1/2 hours waiting we were finally given our room which was a small suite with a semi harbor view. Which was fine. The next day the fun started. You have to have your key to get up in the elevators and I forgot mine MY BAD! I went to the desk and asked for a new one. The front desk clerk Adam said since the room was in my husbands name i could not have a new key made even with id. He should of sent someone up with me and i could verify something in the room but he just said no and that i would have to wait until my husband came from his conference at 6 o'clock and 4 blocks away to get into the room to get in the room. .. Be prepared to have the clerks be totally unhelpful and our right obstructionists! . Finally after a temper fit the manager was called and he said it was ok to give me a new key. It was my mistake to leave the key in the room but it should have been resolved like most hotels do it . #1 The first key didn't work in the lounge which is nice to get water and cokes.. #2 I went back down and got the key re-keyed. It didn't work in the door to the room. #3 Went back down and re-keyed again. which didn't work in one of the doors. #4 Found a helpful supervisor and she took keys down and a manger finally came up with the re-keyed re-keyed re-keyed keys.. #5 Husband has old key and since their keying system stinks I will have to go down again to get him up in the elevator and into room.. So if you want to spend your vacation hunting keys and not getting into a room this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need attention”
Reviews.Author: Newsgirl361
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt for two days. The location as others have said is great. The hotel I am sure when first built was amazing - It needs attention now. I used to be a maid a resort and am therefore very picky about the details that make a difference. We walked on the room was warm and musty We stayed for two days with the AC set to 60 and the room was only comfortable at night - when we weren't moving around. This was disappointing since is was 100 degrees out. We booked on priceline and charged $30 more a day for a king bed and Harbor view. If I had know that I would have bid higher with the hope a getting a newer hotel. The pool is postage stamp size. When we went to look out the window at the view in our room - the settee was stained The carpet was stained with some red substance. The shower has mildew ib several place counter was dusty. The wallpaper was peeling under vanity and dust and hair accumulated in the room corners. The tissue holder was not polished and has fingerprints on it - yes I'm picky. Last they should not charge guests 30 to park. I would try a different hotel when I return. Yes everyone was smiling and said hi -

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are nice, but that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: wowkatk
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for only one night. I was pleased with the room, and the cleaning ladies were really kind, however the hotels pool is really tiny, the gym had flies flying around in it, and the hot tub was shallow and just for two people. I'm am not too sure how up to date it was either. The hotels lobby looks nice, but if you are planning to enjoy the hotels amenities then you'll be dissapointed. Also, you have to use your room key to go to a floor on the elevator. Alot of times it doesn't work or the elevator starts moving, and it passes your floor, etc. Alot of people on the elevator were annoyed by this. Mine didn't work at all and I was on the way to the gym, and got stuck going to the lobby. I just went ahead and asked them to fix my card instead of taking the stairs, but I didn't have my id on me. The woman at the front desk then said she would call a security guard to escort me to my room to get my id. I was really upset by this. She then changed her mind, probably because she could see how unhappy I was, and just called the room to talk to my boyfriend to verify that I was who I said I was. This is not a nice enough hotel to be so up tight. I didn't complain, because I'm sure that's she was just doing her job and that's just thier policy, but it's a bad policy to have. It is DEFINITELY NOT worth paying the full price, especially after they nickle and dime you for everything. Internet is $20, but they have another type of internet they offer that, if you exceed a certain bandwidth, they will dissconnect you for $10. Parking is $27. Also, Instead of giving you a fridge they give you a mini bar. Don't plan on keeping any leftovers. Luckily, I used hotwire and payed little to stay here. I stayed at the aloft (three star) in the bwi hotel district before and the staff was way friendlier, everything was much more updated, and their internet was free. Basically, this hotel is not worth paying full price for. 120 at the most. It doesn't feel like a four star hotel. If you want to stay in a hotel in the inner harbor, I'd recomend the Marriott waterfront. It was nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Another Hyatt Gem”
Reviews.Author: maurzzzz
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location...If your attending a function at Baltimore Harbor this is the place to stay. Located steps away from the convention center and the activities surrounding the harbor, this Hyatt was great! My room, being a corner Bay View was more than I ever expected. Wall to wall windows on two sides the view was nothing short of stellar. The only problem i encountered was with the shower. In order to turn it on, I had reach in..as the door was on the left..main controls to the right...making a wet head the problem of the day! Other than that our breakfast choice was buffet..and as good as it gets! The hotel was staffed with "Four Star" associates...nothing was a problem! Hats off to the management!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but bring own pack and play”
Reviews.Author: buffaloali
Reviews.Content: I had a business conference here and extended the stay to visit nearby family. Like many hotels, wireless was extra. We had our baby with us and asked for a crib and fridge. Despite being requested at the time of reservation, we had to call down once we arrived. Both were brought to the room...the fridge worked fine. The crib was an old wobbly pack and play. On the positive side, they provided baby shampoo and lotion.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service but expect to pay for everything”
Reviews.Author: Pamela0627
Reviews.Content: A highlight of this hotel is the service and attentiveness of the staff. Everyone is extremely helpful, courteous, and pleasant. They do not wait for you to ask for help but instead offer assistance first. We paid almost $300 a night for over 10 rooms and you would think we would get some extras. No internet service provided. They wanted to charge an outrageous fee per person. No screen for the conference room - an extra charge. The rooms were fine but nothing special. Carpeting was stained in areas, a few markings on the wall. But the room was comfortable and a good size.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LindaPez
Reviews.Content: We stayed @Hyatt Regency for a night before out trip to DC. This hotel is in a beautiful, accessible location to the Inner Harbor. Also, we cannot stop talking about the customer service (150%) in this hotel!!! Staff was extremely helpful and w more than willing to facilitate our stay!!! Words cannot describe our satisfaction at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great service a good choice for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: Strategicevents
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference at the convention center in June, as was very impressed with the service at this hotel. The location is very convenient to everything (Harbor, Camden Yards and the Convention Center). Though not much to look at from the exterior, once inside it is very clean and current. The rooms are nice with comfortable beds, good sized bathrooms and are very quiet. A sample of toothpaste was left along with the usual amenities which was a nice touch. The general manager introduced herself to me in the elevator and I found the staff overall to be very gracious. When I arrived there was a long line to check in and a bellman was helpful in assisting me with the automated check in, which was very speedy. Lastly upon check out there was a dining room charge that was not mine on the invoice, when I went to the front desk it was removed, no questions asked with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Dandyone
Reviews.Content: This hotel worked out perfectly for my business traveling spouse and me who was a tourist. It is located near the central business district as well as the Inner Harboe which is home to several tourist attractions. It is also walking distance to Camden Yards, so I was able to catch a game as well. The rooms are spacious enough and the bathroom is large. We had a room facing the Inner Harbor so it was quiet with a lovely view. Did not try the restaurants and the bellman was nice enough to recommend a restaurant within walking distance from the hotel. No fee Internet unless you are a Hyatt Club member.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: MYOTravels
Reviews.Content: I attended a family reunion in Baltimore; however we were staying near the airport. I wanted to experiene the city since I've nevery been before so I came in a day earlier and stayed overnight at the Hyatt Regency because I wanted to be closer to the Inner Harbor. I was solo and I was extremely pleased with my choice. The location was perfect (including a skywalk to the mall) and my hotel room was very beautiful, clean, and nice city/harbor view). Check-in was easy and the staff was friendly and helpful. If you're looking for an indoor pool, sorry not happening and the outside pool was remote and not very friendly for a solo guest. However, I did enjoy the fitness room and the restaurant. I loved that the location was close to the city free shuttle bus and 3 blks from Camden Yards and the light rail (actually I took the light rail from the airport). Would recommend to my family and friends. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: wasthechief
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Hyatt this past weekend for the Fire Expo, we checked in about 12:15 a.m. on Friday morning and the Manager, Patricia was extremely helpful in checking us in and spending time pointing out crab and steakhouses in the area. The first room we stayed in was on the 14th floor and the air conditioning was not working and it was very warm in the room, late Friday night they moved us to another room on the 3rd floor and the view was the back of the hotel and the room was outdated and musty and the air conditioning did not work. The Bellman Jesse was amazing, he moved us to the new room and made sure we were settled before he left us as well as providing us with refreshments to cool off. Saturday night the room was very warm and I spoke with the Manager, Patricia and she was able to issue us a credit toward the bill and called maintenance to have them look at the air conditioning, unfortunately, maintenance did not come and look at it at and at 1:30 a.m. we were still up and very warm. We checked out today and Joe the Bellman was incredible, he offered us lunch in the Bistro but we chose to start our Journey home to NY earlier then we wanted to and I then saw Patricia the Manager and once again she was extremely helpful and issued us a gift card for a future visit at a Hyatt. The Customer Service Excellence provided by Patricia, Jesse and Joe was fabulous and they could not apologize enough, they really went above and beyond. We love staying at Hyatt hotels the only complaint that we have is the paying $9.95 for Internet and $27.00 a day for parking. Kudos for the Customer Service Excellence that your staff provided to help make our stay more enjoyable. Hopefully our trip next year to the Hyatt will be better. The weather was really hot this past weekend but the rooms should have much cooler then they were.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Sendoff”
Reviews.Author: KBKTravel
Reviews.Content: Just checked out of this hotel on a one night business stay. At time, I thought the $36 per night valet parking was a little high. All of that was forgotten as I left the hotel. The 100 degree+ heat wave has Baltimore in it's grasp. I stopped in the Regency Club to get a bottle of water before I left. They had been cleaned out. A big Fire Show is in town and the water at the Convention Center is $4 a bottle. The kind valet helps me load my luggage and tells me there are TWO cold bottles of water in my car in the holders since it was so hot. Great service and kindness!! I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: jaafha
Reviews.Content: We booked a 1 night stay at the Hyatt Regency Baltimore thru Priceline for around $100 with tax & fees. The location is great - very close to Orioles Park at Camden Yards & right in the Inner Harbor area - an easy walk. Staff was very friendly & helpful & even though the only room available was with 2 double beds, it was clean & comfortable with crisp linens & comfy pillows. We did not eat at the restaurant but did use the $36 valet parking. Again, the valet staff were super nice!

Reviews.Title: “Dated, worn out rooms”
Reviews.Author: johng1974
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at this hotel, the first time I stayed about 4 years ago the hotel was in much better shape. On my most recent stay the lobby still looks great but the rooms are in need of renovation and 2 of the 3 towels in my room were filthy with what appeared to have grease or shoe polish on them. Unfortunately the top floor bar restaurant Pices has closed. However the staff and outdoor pool were great. This hotel is in a great location if you want to walk to the inner harbor. The inner harbor has become pretty dead and depressing over the past couple of years, it appears that everything has moved over to Fells Point near the Marriott Waterfront. I do not think I would return to this hotel, I would recommend the Monaco or Marriott Waterfront over the Hyatt and they are usually less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A 4* property....maybe in 1991”
Reviews.Author: wagamoto
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a solid 3* property. If you are expecting a luxury hotel, you will need to get yourself a time-machine and take it back about 15-20 years. All in all, it was an unpleasant stay as I was expecting more. The Good: nothing The Decent: -View of inner harbor -Comfortable mattress -Convenient location to Inner Harbor and the main water taxi stop -Shower (no tub) is large. -(inadvertently) free wi-fi (re-connect to the lobby connection every 30 min) The Bad: -Furniture was battered and old -Coffee machine was an old Hamilton beach drip unit, and it was really dirty -The entire staff, notably the front desk staff were a step below professional -Pool looks like a motel 6 pool, very small, and the area was not well appointed. -can hear hallway noise easily from bed -Room was poorly appointed overall. -$5 for for a bottle of Aquafina in the room when it is 95 degrees outside is mildly irritating. The Ugly: -Room had large red carpet stain next to the bed -Old gum compressed into the middle of the carpet between bed and TV area. -Bed sheets stained -Toilet had no tank behind it, just a bowl (unsightly) -a brad new washcloth was noticeably dirty. -Towels were small and scratchy I have most likely lost faith in the Hyatt brand based on my recent stay. (July 9-11) and will certainly try out a different option when staying in the Inner Harbor area again.

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly, eager to help, excellent guest services.”
Reviews.Author: pixxistiks
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right across the street from Harborplace, easy to get in, easy to get out, and they were AWESOME. The drain in our shower didn't work, so they moved us to another floor, the floor the girl at the desk moved us to happened to contain a Frat reunion, so the manager moved us to a suite, sent champagne and strawberries, gave us free breakfast vouchers and a free movie for our trouble. You can go to a hotel and they will act like jerks if you so much as ask for more towels, they were ridiculously accommodating. We go to Baltimore all the time, we will never stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK.. Not Bad, but Not Great”
Reviews.Author: Butterfrog
Reviews.Content: Pros: Perfect location right on the Harbor. There's a nice bridge that brings you straight from the hotel's 2nd floor to the harbor, shopping and entertainment. Gift shop is stocked pretty well, expensive, but you will probably find what you need- and the open hours are pretty good, too. The beds were fantastic and there was a small couch in the room perfect for my 15yr old to sleep on comfortably. Customer Service is fantastic. Cons: No free breakfast, no wired internet in room, no free internet (even the business center costs $), no courtesy van to bring patrons anywhere if it is raining (had to walk across the street in the rain to my sister's wedding), The TV was flat screened, but not high def.

Reviews.Title: “My husband and I had an amazing time in Baltimore and the Hyatt is a top of the line hotel”
Reviews.Author: wkulp
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt and its staff made our trip to Baltimore fantastic. The Hyatt is in a perfect location to the the Inner Harbor. The room was clean and all of the staff very friendly. This was our first time visiting Baltimore and could not have asked for more

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roll-About
Reviews.Content: Wonderful property, located next to all the shopping and dining in the inner harbor. Right next door to Ruth Chis Steak House. Totally like new property. Bathroom could be larger but was fine. Great work space. Plenty of outlets. Even a iHome dock for iPhone! Flat Screen TV and everything else you expect from a Hyatt Regency. Good price for the area. Large room. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for Baltimore's Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: luv2trvl247
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here in June. My husband and I were in town for a concert at the nearby First Mariner Arena. The hotel staff were friendly and attentive. Restaurant and room service quality and service were excellent. Very comfortable bedding. Great views of the Inner Harbor from our uniquely laid out corner room with King bed and floor to ceiling windows on two sides. I highly recommend requesting one of these corner rooms. The Hyatt's location is perfect for activities in and near the Inner Harbor; walking distance to shopping, restaurants, sporting events, and aquarium. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive Staff”
Reviews.Author: CJMTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business. Excellent location if you are attending a meeting at the Convention Center as it is directly across the street. Room was spacious and comfortable. My safe was locked so I had to call security to get them to open it. Strange but four other people I spoke with had the exact same issue with their safe. Also, you have to contact the front desk if you want the mini bar opened. The plastic holder for the coffee was missing from my coffee maker and asked for a replacement. It was not done. Last and most important issue... BED BUGS...when I found them I was freaked out...but it was 2:00 am. Location is good for inner harbor activities, baseball and football games.

Reviews.Title: “Our experience was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: janis328
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency for a weekend in June, 2011, and everything about our stay was wonderful. The staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful from the person who checked us in (noticed it was our anniversary and immediately wished us a happy one), the bellboy, Joe who took us and our baggage to our room and explained everything in it, the gentleman in the Regency Club who provided us with all of the amenities as well as the lady and her daughter who helped us with breakfast, the concierge who sent up John Thomas to give us a tour of Picses, and our server at Bistro 300, Willie who offered menu suggestions and was so attentive to our needs. The room was immaculate as was the entire hotel. As I have already stated, our experience was wonderful, and we hope to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid high star place to stay in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Traveling20something
Reviews.Content: I ran a race in Baltimore last weekend, so I wanted to spend the night there to have more time in the morning rather than drive from VA. I actually ended up with the Hyatt Regency from bidding on Priceline for a 4 star. But having stayed there now, if there was any reason Id have to stay over in Baltimore again, I'd probably book directly with them. On check in the receptionist was more than kind. She was sweet, cheerful and inquisitive. We talking about running after I told her about the 10 mile race in the morning requesting a room further from the elevator (hoping for a quite night's sleep). She was super accommodating not only giving us a room all the way down the hall, but on an upper floor with a harbor view. I felt guilty since we wouldn't even get to enjoy it! Now unfortunately we were in an adjoining room. At midnight, our next door neighbors arrived and this woman wouldn't have needed a microphone to speak to a football field full of people. I tried to let it go and will myself back to sleep, but after 30 minutes of it I had to call the front desk. Impressively they sent up security 5 minutes later, and I got my remaining 5 hours of sleep! And the beds are comfy!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaKml
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Baltimore is my new favorite hotel on the Inner Harbor. We had connecting rooms on the 5th floor the weekend of June 11 & 12th. From check in to check out, the whole stay was perfect. The location can't be beat, you are across the street from the entrance to the harbor with a water taxi stop right there. Walk a few blocks the other direction to Camden Yards. Many, many restaurants and things to do, all at your doorstep. We were greeted by a representative immediately upon arrival and offered self check in or we could go to the front desk, which we chose as I had some questions. Front desk very friendly & helpful. We were offered bell services but declined as we had only a few small bags. The rooms are nicely decorated, not too small. Our room was not waterfront so the view was not terrific in the daytime but at night it was pretty with the city lights. We had a nightcap in the bar Saturday night and the atmosphere is nice, restful after a long day in the heat of Baltimore but not stuffy, just relaxed.
