Excellent coffee in the main atrium, we grabbed a cup before heading out to breakfast. Did not try the hotel restaurant but overheard a couple in the elevator talking and they seemed to like it. All in all, we had a wonderful time, can't wait to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Staff”
Reviews.Author: NoVa_Chris
Reviews.Content: I drove up from northern Virginia to catch the Kansas City Royals while they were in town. The staff was the friendliest and most helpful I have encountered in years. The location cannot was perfect; just a few blocks from Oriole Park at Camden Yards and one block from the Inner Harbor. The hotel lobby is definitely 4-star. While the rooms might lack what some might consider 4-star amenities, it was a nice sized room and very comfortable. I cannot say enough how great the staff treated me. From the front desk clerk, to the concierge, to the security staff, to the manager and on and on. I was just a guy dressed in Kansas City Royals clothing and I was treated as if I were a VIP. That alone was worth the stay. Considering the price of a 2-star hotel in the Inner Harbor area, the Hyatt is the best deal you will find in the area. I will definitely stay at the Hyatt on my next trip to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean and Friendly, but more than a little dated.....”
Reviews.Author: savemyfish
Reviews.Content: Stayed with Wife the first weekend in May. We took the Light Rail in to the convention center stop and walked to the hotel. Location is very walkable with easy access to Light Rail, and the "Charm City Circulator" the free downtown bus. Also an easy walk to Camden Yards and the Inner Harbor. We took the Circulator to Fells Point with no problems at all. The biggest issue with the hotel is that it's very dated.....the lobby area felt like a time warp to 1987. The only way up to the rooms was via a bank of glass elevators, which provided great views of the inner harbor but could also cause some nausea for some people. The room itself was clean and nice, but not quite up to standards of modern hotels. Another downside I saw was the pool/tennis area. It wasn't open yet, but it didn't look very appealing. Maybe they clean it up for the summer, but it still looked like the area hadn't been updated since the hotel opened. Overall - decent location and easy to get around baltimore, but a little bit dated.

Reviews.Title: “Bed very uncomfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Ellenisha
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for two nights at the Hyatt. Upon arriving was told they only had double beds. Crystal was able to find a queen room for my husband and I. We thought how lucky we were for Crystal to be able to find a queen room. Upon arriving in the room we were greeted with loud screeching noises coming from the gigantic ventilation system or airconditioning system next to our hotel windows. Who could possibly sleep with the loud noise coming from the units on the roof, and for Crystal to even suggest that we sleep in this room is beyond belief . Crystal had to know the circumstances of this room because I am sure any guest who they suggested this room to resulted in the same action that we took. We called Crystal and explained why we wanted to have our room changed. She came to our room personally with a new key for another room that she said was an upgrade. To my surprise, if this new room was an upgrade I would hate to see what a down grade was:( The two nights that we spent in this room was the worst two nights I ever spent in any hotel, considering my husband and I travel often in and out the country. The upgrade that Crystal gave us was two double beds. One of the beds had such a deep sink in it and was impossible to be comfortable. My husband and I slept in the double bed which was very uncomfortable since we are use to King size beds and we are big and tall people. In all fairness if not for the uncomfortable room the hotel is very nice. Would I stay there again, not sure. The parking fee is $27.00 per night and there is a fee to use the internet. Thank you Crystal for your upgrade. I could not wait to get back home to write this review.

Reviews.Title: “After anticipating a nice stay, this hotel was disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: EW188
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on this hotel through Hotwire, and given its location on the harbor and four-star status, I was anticipating a nice stay while showing some friends the city. Check-in was slower than it needed to be. We were given a 4th floor "partial water view" room. Upon arriving, the room was facing the back of the hotel and there was no water or harbor view to be had at all. Additionally, it seems like the lower floor rooms were very close, overhanging the lobby, so privacy and quietness was lacking. Since we were staying one night, we decided that it would be fine. There was a high school prom being thrown there this particular Saturday night. Late in the evening, the noise level became very loud with intoxicated high school students scouring around the hotel. Since it was well after midnight and we were in bed, we felt it was too late to request a room change. The thinness of the walls and poor construction of the hotel contributed to the noise problem. The bathroom was nice, and the room was of a sufficient size. There was nothing very comfortable about it, though. The expectedly expensive parking, pay wireless internet, average room, and noise problem made this stay unpleasant. I expected more from a Hyatt on the downtown waterfront, and after staying at the Renaissance years ago and looking at the outside appearance of the other hotels nearby, I will definitely avoid this dated facility in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RidinWaves
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my recent stay at the Hyatt Regency Baltimore. I am a loyal Marriott customer and I got a great deal for this hotel on Expedia so I gave it a shot. Lets just say I booked my next stay in DC with a Hyatt as well! I arrived late and check in was easy. The Front desk clerk, Valet and Doormen were very nice. I arrived in my room and it was clean and nice, the only issue I saw was a spot on the bench which of course I avoided like the plague. Otherwise the room was very nice. A beautiful view of the Harbor with floor to ceiling windows. There were extra pillows which I requested which was a nice attention to detail. I had to hurry and get to the bar/restaurant before it closed at midnight as I my flight into Baltimore was very late. Even though it was 15 minutes to close the wonderful bartender not only let me order food but stay and eat it while she was closing up. Thank you Debbie! Then I witnessed her serve another guest who showed up five minutes after closing. She even chatted with us both. This is great service at midnight! The housekeeper Chantay was very friendly and did a wonderful job refreshing my room while I was out at the Inner Harbor. She even wrote me a sweet note thanking me for the tip. The bed was very comfortable and the shower was nice. There were only two issues I dealt with while I was there... first one is a preference, I like a hotel hairdryer attached to the wall for convenience and cleanliness. The one they had was underneath the sink on a shelf and did not feel like it was cleaned very often. The other issue was that I put one of the large bottles of water in the fridge that was on the table and a flyer was left instructing me not to place things in the fridge. I called down to get a fridge so I could have my $5 bottle of water cold but they never brought me one even though they said they would. Neither issues were a big deal just little things that I would fix if I were the manager. There should be room left in the fridge for a guests bottle of water or an additional guest fridge. If I am willing to pay $5 for your bottle of water I should be able to keep it cold if I would like. I would definitely stay there again. Baltimore is a great place to visit with so many fun things to do and the Hyatt Regency Baltimore is in a perfect location to see them all!

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to those old bad review-its great!”
Reviews.Author: azscubadiver
Reviews.Content: I don't know what was going on in 2006 but most of the bad reviews are really old. We stayed at the club level and it was really pretty quite great. The club room was open every time I tried to go in, even 630am breakfast (smoked salmon, fresh berries and fruits and cheeses, quite the spread). The room was roomy and clean, and the bathroom isn't the typical closet. The location was great-right across the street from the inner harbour with lots of shopping and eats. The staff was great and when I had a broken hair dryer they had a new one to me quick-at 6am. Overall a great experience-and i travel a LOT

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but really just a three-star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: nws103
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four nights at the Hyatt Regency in Baltimore. As I said in the title, the location here is great. It was a short walk over the bridge to the harbor, leading right to restaurants and shops and plenty to do. But without the location, things go downhill pretty quickly. Its not that the hotel wasn't nice, because it certainly was decent. It just wasn't nice like a usual Hyatt would be. I find it odd that the Hyatt in the mid-sized upstate NY city where I live is truly in a higher class than the Hyatt in a world-class city like Baltimore. There were just a multitude of odd things combining to make this not a 4-star experience. To be fair, let me first mention a few positives about this hotel though: The fitness room was definitely four-star quality. In addition, so were the bell-hops/valet guys. They couldn't have been nicer. I can only assume the front desk staff was of the same quality, though with the kiosk for checking in I didn't even need to talk with them. Now, let's get to the real issues this hotel has: 1)The parking garage elevator dumps you off at the bottom of a long ramp outside the hotel entrance. So, after paying $28 to park per day, you still have to walk uphill, outside just to get to the hotel? Sorry, but I'm used to garage elevators at nice hotels actually taking me to the hotel! 2)Only internet option available: wireless via T-Mobile available to buy by the day. Yes, it is tacky to charge, but that's not even my beef here, since I know for some odd reason the current trend is for "prestigious" hotels to charge for internet, whilst lesser "value" options give you free access. The real issue here is lack of a secure wired connection. This wireless-only option basically eliminates serious business travelers from using this hotel. 3)Maybe I'm a geek, but the first thing I do when I get to a hotel room is read the little guide-book for the hotel itself. The guidebook for the Hyatt in Baltimore looks like it was written by someone who had probably never set foot in the Baltimore Hyatt. It had very little detailed information about anything, with the exception of the cringe-inducing pricing of the room-service menu. 4)One word: Pisces. A much whispered about roof-top "event venue" that you can't miss seeing signs to in the elevators, yet appears to be entirely private and for rentals only (This I only determined afterward, since there was literally no written word about it in the previously mentioned guidebook!). If part of your hotel is strictly for non-hotel guests, please have a separate entrance for it. I spent the whole week thinking I was missing out on something. 5) Continuing the design flaws first mentioned in number one: the bridge to the harbor, while a good idea, is strangely hidden off the far side of the 2nd floor of the hotel. So I can almost guarantee everyone going to the harbor from the hotel will miss this bridge during their first trip to the harbor. In fact, it is so poorly designed, that when returning to the hotel via the bridge, you will walk through the registration tables for whatever conference is going on at the hotel! Not to mention, the fact that the bridge is so far out of the way no doubt contributes to the problem of it being a mecca for the homeless. One was curled up with a book reading or napping next to a garbage can one evening when my wife and I were returning from the harbor! At least the homeless are well-read here. Additional security concerns I would note are the entrances and elevators to the hotel: while the elevator plainly states you need your room key to access the 4th-14th floors, we came and went at all hours and never once had to use the swipe card to get to the 14th floor! Never had to swipe to get into the hotel either, regardless of time or entrance chosen. Kind of scary in hindsight. Last but not least, warm bottled water waiting for you every day above the mini-bar... Did I really see "$5" written in tiny lettering on the card attached to each bottle? I feel awful for anyone who accidentally drank one of those! Can't wait to go back to Baltimore, but I will be trying the InterContinental or the Renaissance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Quietgirl7
Reviews.Content: My fiancee & I stayed at this hotel from Mar 11-13 & it was a pleasant experience. When we checked in the front desk staff was very friendly & even offered an upgrade to a suite & included free overnight parking & a snack/cocktail that was delivered to the room just after we checked into our room. The suite was nice upgrade & looked to be two corner rooms that were made into a two-room suite & had a nice view of the Harbor across the street. The room's decor was very nice & the two bathrooms had nice, roomy showers. The bed was comfy & we also relaxed in the living room area watching the flat-screen tv. On both mornings, we ate at the Bistro 300 restaurant & the buffet (included in our hotel package) was surprisingly nice. The food was plentiful, very tasty & again the staff was friendly. There are two overhead walkways from the hotel to the Harbor, which is nice because that means not having to cross 4-5 lanes of traffic getting to the Harbor. We would definitely stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “C+ on a good day, location is the only up side”
Reviews.Author: Momoftwo
Reviews.Content: Initially upon arrival I thought that the hotel was pretty nice, when we walked into our rooms both of my children immediately noticed the flush handle on the toilets which is metal and looks like what you would see in a high school bathroom. The rest of the decor is simple and nice so the gym toilets really diminish the aesthetic appeal. Queen size bed was tiny and hard & none of us got any sleep because of the noise in the hallways at night. Staff seemed nice, so many milling about in lobby. Location works well for aquarium visit and other sites located in the waterfront. Last year we stayed at The Renaissance which is a block closer to the heart of the activities and far more upscale for about $25 more a night.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Internet Service Ever. Damaging to my business.”
Reviews.Author: atraveler300_11
Reviews.Content: The TMobile internet service was not functioning properly, which prevented me from doing business for a day. They explained someone was abusing bandwidth. I don't care. I had 40 emails to respond to after dinner, and could only respond to 2. This is a catastrophic failure, and I will never come here again. I have gotten far better internet service at La Quinta.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on the heart of Baltimore!”
Reviews.Author: cederbergs
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for business. Perfect location with lots to do and see within walking distance. Great nights sleep too... Try Kona Grill next door, great sushi!

Reviews.Title: “Great, perfect place to stay in the Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: mazeyday
Reviews.Content: Loved staying here, the views of the Inner Harbor from the rooms are so fun! Take a cab over to Little Italy for a fabulous meal! Rooms have nice decor and are clean, with huge windows. If you want to enjoy everything in the Inner Harbor the Hyatt is a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not worth the $$”
Reviews.Author: IH8BOSTON
Reviews.Content: For the price this place is not worth it! I guess if you have trouble walking and want to be close to the inner harbor then this place could be for you. If you like to walk and take in the sights stay further up Pratt Street and save yourself some $. I will stay closer to the Orioles stadium in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Location is not the only thing that matters”
Reviews.Author: seaflowers
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and I'm really not fussy about where I stay. Of course certain perks are always good. For the Hyatt Regency Baltimore, the location can't be better (you are literally steps from the waterfront shops). HOWEVER, location isn't everything. Check-in was initially pleasant. I was greeted with smiles, but when I asked them to check for my rewards number in their computer (because I didn't have my card), the guy wrote it down on a post-it and said he would check later ..... which would have been fine except I was the only one in line and I felt like I was being blown off. I'm a gold member for Marriott and Hilton, but this does not make me wish to stay enough nights to reach gold member status with Hyatt! The room is fine. Nice furnishings -- a new window seat since I've been here last. I am usually tired after a long day of work, so I tend to like ordering room service. I know this isn't technically a restaurant review, but the room service food during this stay has been DREADFUL. They had no health-consious options on their menu so I stuck with soup: - For lunch, before my meetings, I ordered Chicken tortilla soup. I requested it without the tortilla strips on top. They said it didn't come with tortilla strips on top. It arrived with tortilla strips on top. I mentioned it was wrong, but did not explicitly ask for a new bowl, so of course they didn't offer. I ate it anyway. The chicken was awful: sauteed chicken breast with italian seasoning (in mexican soup??) cut up and mixed in as an after thought. Not tasty at all, and not a good flavor combination. - For dinner, I ordered chicken noodle/mazo ball soup. I have had this soup from the Hyatt in Chicago before and it was amazing. This was horrible, and the chef should go take lessons from their Chicago twin. Guess what? It had the SAME (exact) leftover seasoned, sliced up chicken breast in it, also thrown on top of the soup as an after thought. It ruined the flavor, and there were no vegetables in the soup except for one piece of uncooked carrot. Also, the gentleman who brought me my food was completely taken aback that I asked him to take the lunch tray with him when he left. He tried to get me to leave it outside the door... which might have been fine on a different day, but not this day. Also, the internet has been frustrating me all night. I have to connect via a VPN for work, but they do not have an option for higher bandwith for advanced application users. So my VPN keeps timing out, and I can't watch my slingbox because there' s just not enough juice. I don't mind this when the internet is free, but here it is not free. Perhaps tomorrow will be better (I'm here for two more nights), but since I am stuck wishing I had gone out to eat and bored because I can't do work or use advanced computer applications, this hotel gets a mediocre review. My preference from now on is going to be the Baltimore Marriott Waterside. Have not had a bad experience there yet (they even usually offer me the town car back to the airport), and I just can't imagine getting that kind of service here.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the 80's style”
Reviews.Author: Quintillian
Reviews.Content: Great location in what is really a rather dull place. You don't want to venture outside too much! The hotel is lots of shiny marble, glass and concrete. Online check in is a nice touch, although it did give me an error message but had checked me in. Room was sizeable, flat screen tv, air, nice sized bathroom, but pitiful shower water pressure. Nice clean feel to the place and comfy bed. The internet worked beautifully during my stay on the laptop - hated my iPhone. Could not get it to log in! Food was ok, bland really, but breakfast offered a good buffet selection and the staff were all friendly enough. I had room service and whilst the burger was edible, the caesar salad was a joke - brown lumps of lettuce dumped in some sauce. The dessert made up for it though! I would not recommend this hotel to a friend, mainly cos I think my friends would be looking for something a little less bland, but for business, it does the job.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the $ that you pay”
Reviews.Author: Calo612
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hyatt for a convention that was in Baltimore. On checked I discovered that the room was quite dirty and immediately contacted the front desk for a room move. Unfortunately the hotel was sold out and unable to accommodate my request. As it was quite late I just wanted to go to sleep and asked that the room be serviced the next morning. After checking several times with the desk and the managers this request was not ever taken seriously. When I asked for a comment card to make a complaint the first manager refused to give one stating that they had already addressed my concerns. The second manager did given me a comment card as I demanded three times to have one. Please note that the room was never cleaned after several requests. The manager did call me on my phone at home but only commented that they understood that I had questions- Not good customer service at all. After speaking with several different people at the conference there was several other people that felt that their rooms were in the same state. The restaurant was phenomenal as well as the servers in this area, particularly Penny and Jason and the hostess whom I never received her name. On a whole this really affected how I felt about my stay; a refund was given although it was not given in a gracious way.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing absolutely terrible, but I was expecting more”
Reviews.Author: jo6688
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple of nights while traveling on business. The room was incredibly small, though I was alone, so it was alright. The bed was decent, things were clean. I had some major problems with the internet though. It took about 45 minutes to log on the first time and I had to be connected to the internet company's headquarters in Texas for 30 minutes or more. The rooms have an entire wall of windows. No dry wall at all. This would have been wonderful except my room faced other hotel rooms and the glass elevators on the outside of the building. Even with the sheer curtain closed, I could see the lights of the elevator all night long and all the people in it. The breakfast buffet was $19 and was certainly not worth it. The food was decent, but the Dunkin Donuts down the street would be cheaper and just as good. On the upside, It was a great distance from the convention center and Inner Harbor where all the shops and restaurants are. The staff was friendly and called my room to make sure everything was all right. It was obvious that quality service was important to them. I probably wouldn't stay here again. I'd take my chances and see other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, dated, noisy-3 night stay”
Reviews.Author: MarianaG
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel and used the computer lobby check in and was given a room on the 4th floor above the bar, back to the desk. Then off I went to the 9th floor to a room where the safe was locked. Security did unlock the safe. The rooms are dated, the rugs are worn and dirty. The couches and chairs are stained. The bathroom has been updated and is nice. They do not give you enough towels. Do not expect toilet paper or cups to be replaced, you will have to get them yourself from the cart. The bed and pillows are OK. The parking is disgusting and next to the hotel and smells like urine. The Baltimore area has some nice restaurants but is not the safest neighborhood, notice all the police officers patrolling. Lastly, if anyone walks by your room or is talking you will hear them and I have found this to be true of all Hyatts.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, friendly staff, fine biz hotel”
Reviews.Author: usflyer
Reviews.Content: I am normally a Hilton person, so this was a first in a while back at a Hyatt, which was due to the conference I was attending. GOOD - Nice location right off the waterfront (note, not ON the waterfront, as you have to cross a street or use the connected bridge walk). Upper floors have nice view of the harbor. - Staff were all very friendly. - Free USA Today and WSJ available in the lobby (I would have preferred room delivery like my preferred chains) - I suppose the good is just that there was nothing of note, I had no complaints, slept well, and found the facilities acceptable. - Free coffee with coffee maker in room. BAD - On the same line as above, the hotel was very undistinguished and could be any other generic business hotel. - Rooms are pricey. My conference rate was $200 but normal rate was around $350. You can stay about 2 blocks farther away for half the price. - Facility restaurants are also VERY expensive, so I ate every meal over by the waterfront (ex. Cheesecake factory). - No free wireless. - Spotty room service, never cleaned up my ice bucket or provided new bags for ice. The bed was comfortable and there was a nice desk and nice flat panel TV, and a nice alarm that worked perfectly. That said, the room kind of was appropriate for Baltimore in general - it looked pretty nice and shiny when you walked in, but the more you looked at stuff in detail over the stay, you noticed the room was pretty rough around the edges. Carpet warn, old shower. I wouldn't have a problem staying here again as I had no problems, but I won't remember it a week from now and won't be rushing to stay here either.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: pulickal3
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for my cousin's wedding. The hotel is in a perfect location and easy access to reach there and don't miss it. Also it is in the center of Baltimore and walking distance to shopping and site seeing. Rooms are as usual like other hotels and we had only the breakfast and it was perfect. Room service also ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the inner harbor”
Reviews.Author: colormeelmo
Reviews.Content: Baltimore Hyatt Regency Inland Waterway You couldn’t have a better location for a hotel in Baltimore’s inner harbor area. It is right at the very apex of all that is happening. You are just steps away from most of what Baltimore has to offer. There is a special, free bus line with stops near the hotel that has routes for both north/south and east/west travel which we found very helpful. The staff at the hotel were especially friendly and helpful. Everything appeared to be very clean and well maintained. We very much enjoyed both the meal and the service at the hotel’s restaurant which also included a lovely, free dessert. The hotel and our room were beautiful, in a modern, glass, chrome and concrete sort of way. Our room wasn’t facing the waterway but the huge, floor-to-ceiling window still offered a spectacular view. We had just a few complaints. 1. We found our room physically uncomfortable to spend time in because there was no soft seating and although the bed looked very comfortable it was anything but. There was some kind of heavy duty mattress pad that just made sleeping in the bed very difficult. 2. The hotels hot tub is so small, poorly located and has no towels around it. They would be better off just getting rid of it if this is what they’re going to offer. 3. The ice machine on the tenth floor hardly worked. In summery, we really enjoyed our visit to Baltimore and found The Hyatt Regency a great place to stay for business. We would highly recommend it to others because of its great location.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: tahiti98
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights as a getaway weekend. We had never been to Baltimore and enjoyed our visit. The Hyatt staff was very friendly and helpful, always saying hello in the halls and lobby and offering assistance whenever we needed it. We had a room on the Regency Club level, which was the same price as a regular room for the nights we stayed. The club has 24-hour access to water, juice, coffee. There was also a small but adequate evening snack and drink service. We had reservations one night at Roys which has a complimentary shuttle that will pick you up since it is a little too far to walk. A truly pleasant surprise was that when we ordered dessert, the restaurant said it was compliments of the Hyatt. We did not expect that and it really added to our stay. There was construction in the area, so getting to the hotel was not very easy, but that is not the fault of the Hyatt. We also found a great jazz night at the Wine Cellar which was only a few minutes walk. We really loved our stay and will definitely return, both to Baltimore and the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected By Any Means”
Reviews.Author: fitchfamof5
Reviews.Content: 1. After reserving a room that cost $233 per night I expected A+++++ quality. 2. I was shocked to be asked to pay an additional $27 per vehicle for parking fees in a garage that made me fear for my life with all of the hood rats, pimps and prostitutes hanging out. 3. My extra $27 should have gotten me direct access to the building instead of walking through the creepy parking garage. 4. Not a staff member in site after midnight...only the prostitutes and pimps that solicited in the main lobby, bathrooms, elevators & escalators.

Reviews.Title: “great location, very nice hotel, lots of extra charges”
Reviews.Author: nydoc
Reviews.Content: Had quick one night stay as in town for oriole game. PROs 1-excellent location...perfect for camden yards ..about 3-4 block safe walk. great for inner harbor..walk across one of 2 walkways directly into action 2-nice rooms altho double beds arent optimal. small sleeper sofa nice plus.Flat screen tv nice altho kids unhappy that no disney channel there and tv could be bigger. 3-nice rooftop pool with fair tennis courts (small backcout however), running track, and basketball court (free rentals of equipment a plus, basketball pretty dead) Negatives: 1-verrrry slow checkin. took about 20 minutes before i was attended to ,,then only took a few minutes. Part of problem with slowness was everyone had complaints about extra charges being added. Here are a few of the xtra charges I can attest to: 27$/day self parking internet 10$/day 20$ /day or so "restocking Fee" for just opening frig. Dont place your stuff in frig!!!! This gets petty and old real fast at these top dollars Other issues: first several floors (to at least 4th floor) overlook atrium and is quite loud.. with music playing even at 3 am!! Food on premises exorbitantly priced but i guess this is expected. All in all..I would return BUT only at a very discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “Super rooms”
Reviews.Author: brn2trvl_68
Reviews.Content: Went for a conference, friend joined me. Very nice room. Staff met all expectations, delivered on all requests. Delicious food. Within walking distance of shopping, conference center, and several "tourist" attractions. Beds unbelievably comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and incredibly helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: overthetop30
Reviews.Content: if you are looking for a wonderful staff and accomodating staff in one of the best locations in Baltimore, then please stay here. the rooms are business and leisure friendly and the location is very convenient for restaurants and various downtown baltimore harbor sites. the harbor is available using a skywalk inside the hotel and is the pavillion with shops and eateries is right outside the hotel. you do not even need to cross the street. I am glad we chose this hotel for our conference.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Hyatt Regency Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: sexxylypps
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Hyatt Regency, Inner Harbor, Baltimore, MD on the weekend of July 3 - July 5, 2010, and it was a fabulous stay. I was upgraded to a Regency Club King Water View room. When I walked into my room and I saw the Inner Harbor right across the street, I just couldn't believe what a gorgeous view! The heat and humidity were pretty bad that weekend......100 degrees. I chose to go back to my room after dinner on July 4th to view the fireworks right from my room. The view was breathtaking; spectacular; wonderful......I was actually talking to myself out loud saying "oohhhhh and aahhhhhhh". All the staff were very friendly and helpful. Everyone always had a smile on their face. I enjoyed my stay so much that I made reservations for the weekend of August 7 - August 9, 2010. This time I had a King Water View room. Once again, the view was breathtaking. It was so nice to be able to see what was happening right at the Pavillions and the water without having to leave my room. I am already booked for the weekend of Labor Day, September 3 - September 6, 2010. I will have a King Water View room. I will only stay at Hyatts. I have stayed at Hyatts all my life and I am not going to ever change my brand of hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone traveling to Baltimore Inner Harbor!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: momdad123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend to see an Orioles game and the Inner Harbor...what a great place to stay! The hotel was directly across the street from the Inner Harbor and a few blocks away from Camden Yards. We didn't use our car once! The room was spacious and clean (and I am crazy about the clean) and the value could not be beat. We mentioned that we were members of Triple A and the rate was great, included breakfast and parking. Would definitely recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “In the Heart of the Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: girlonthegogo
Reviews.Content: This was my first time residing at a Hyatt Hotel and I must say I loved it. This was the host hotel for my family reunion and all events were held here. The food set up for our banquet was very good. All hotel service was courteous the entire stay. Rooms were clean and comfortable. I got to enjoy a suite and it was off the Inner Harbor and the view was magnificant. The Baltimore Orioles happened to win a game so we got to watch the fireworks. I have no complaints. I'm a native of Baltimore and was amazed and impressed. So if you are a visitor you would love it even more. The restaurant served delicious food. It is pricey but you can never pay too much for quality service. I do plan to start staying at the Hyatt hotels more when I travel.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Not so Good”
Reviews.Author: Jmmm
Reviews.Content: Good: Great location for the Inner Harbor and Camden Yards. Hotel itself was very nice. Not so Good: The room could have been cleaner. We had several spots on the carpets and the mini bar wouldn't open. We told someone about it but no one came to open it. At the Bistro, my son had a bug fly into his drink. It was quickly replaced, but still a turn off. It's the Hyatt Regency. We just expect more. I never felt comfortable in the room. I know that when we check in to a hotel that many people have stayed there before us, but I don't like feeling that way when I am there, and I did. We have stayed at Hyatts before, and are gold club members, but this left us a little disappointed. Also, a very weak shower. Felt like I was in the rain instead of under a shower. Hyatt can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Rooms and Views.....Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: SmileySue300
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hyatt on the Inner Harbor. I was there this past weekend and was blown away. I was a little concerned after reading some of the other reviews, but my experience was great. From the moment I arrived I was greeted with smiles. The lobby was very busy and it appeared to be a line to check in. It took less than 5 minutes and I was greeted with more smiles by the front desk. Within in moments I was on my way to my room which had a great view of the pool and the harbor and even a little of Camden Yard.....I loved it! I went to the pool to catch some sun and they had a bar AND a tv with the World Cup games playing....this blew my mind! I was so excited that I could still listen to the game that I thought I was sacrificing for a tan! I live in Maryland, but will be looking for another get away soon and will definitely choose the Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Raviprakash
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very good. It is on the inner harbour. Many attractions are situated in the close by area, just a few minutes walk away. The room is very neat and clean. Amazing place to stay in and enjoy the harbour. Very good room service. We had the opportunity to take the water boat (local transporation) and went throughout the whole of its journey. Vistied the aquarium. We enjoyed the night life to teh max and this became possible only because of the proximity of the hotel. :) The hotel staffs are very friendly. They are willing to offer help and guide. The rooms are quite good sized with spectacular views. The food was quite good. We had the luch organized for our comapny meeting there and the place (the terrace of the hotel) was amazing. We had very nice view of the harbour and the sea while having food. Overall it was a very memorable experience and I would stay in that place if I get another chance to fly into Baltimore. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “No more Hyatts in my future”
Reviews.Author: Islandz
Reviews.Content: I was in Baltimore for a convention and booked the hyatt at a cheaper rate through my corporate travel instead of the conference rate. When I arrived monday they said there was a problem with the reservation, along with 2 other people at check in next to me. So they said they would put me up at the tremont plaza for the night and can call in the morning to see if there is any availability for Tuesday night. I was angry, but what could I do? So I took the directions to the tremont that were given to me by the front desk and got in my car and drove the route given to me. The first time around I didn't see the hotel. The second time I didn't see the hotel. So now I'm really angry. I only had the hyatt's number and called them. Turns out the person at the front desk had me turn a few blocks too early... So I got to the tremont - and well, it's not exactly close to the convention center. Did not want to stay there (many reasons I will leave out of this), so I was able to get another hotel much closer to where I needed to be. I had chosen this hyatt for it's convenient location to the convention center as well as the inner harbor. I did not want to stay 10 blocks in. The only reason I can think this happened was because the convention rate for the hotel was about $75 more a night than our corporate negotiated rates. I do not think I will be staying at any hyatt brand hotels anytime soon because of this experience.

Reviews.Title: “An Inner Harbor GEM!”
Reviews.Author: takeomeak
Reviews.Content: I could write volumes about our wonderful 2 day weekend get away in Baltimore The entire staff was extremely hospitable, from arrival through check in, to our two wonderful breakfast buffets in the restaurant! We come to Baltimore every year and this is our 4th hotel in as many years. We have found our new annual home at the Hyatt Regency Baltimore!

Reviews.Title: “overwhelmed with kindness”
Reviews.Author: Jerseygirl009
Reviews.Content: it is nice to go to a new city and find warm and caring people. what a treat is was to check into this hotel ! the staff always said hello with a big smile :) what a difference from nyc. i am a fan of hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointment”
Reviews.Author: janbru2
Reviews.Content: Granted we called at the last minute. We were staying at a nice hotel in Timmonium, but decided to stay at the inner harbor the last 2 days. Even though the room was more than twice as expensive as the one in Timmonium, the room was smaller, and it had apparently been set up as a handicap room (which they didnt tell us). It had only a shower that ran all over the floor no matter what you did. It had no vanity, and nowhere to put your toiletries. They also dont replace your towels unless you call them. When its over $300 a night???? They took our washcloths, and never replaced them so when we went to take a shower in the morning we had none. We were told we would have a King bed, but we had a king headboard, but the mattress was a Queen. And nothing special. Everything was overpriced. Even the bottles of water in the room were $5. The restaurant was so so, and again overpriced. The drinks were $10 and the breakfast buffet was $17. We had a waffle, with fruit,(the waffle was typical frozen, not fresh made) coffee and oj and the bill was over $40. The restaurant in Timmonium was far better, and much less expensive. The parking isnt cheap either. The only advantage was that it was on the inner harbor. We go to Baltimore almost yearly, but we will never go to that Hotel again. We have stayed in many Hotels, but this was the worst, and the most expensive. Dont waist your time or money.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: santoki
Reviews.Content: Yeah, the view was nice, but the service - or lack thereof - was just HORRIBLE. The restaurant waiters were surly and ignored us while chatting among themselves. The room decor was tacky - and the beds were only so-so. We have been to many other hotels of four-star range. Other than being close to Inner Harbor, this place was a DUMP. Will NEVER go back. Oh, and the valet parking was a rip-off. The concierge was unprofessional and seemed bored with us.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: SeanClancy
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, worth the couple extra dollars. Used AAA discount. Would definitely do it again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not a 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: lastminutetrips
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night with my four children, ranging in age from 4 to 16. The hotel is right across the street from the Inner Harbor so that part was great. Also, most of the staff were very nice, especially at the registration desk and the coffee stand. On the down side, the lobby is sort of dingy, and we got a bad steer for dinner from the concierge, who seemed to be reading from a script. I asked him to recommend a restaurant that served hard-shell crabs and he sent us to a place that not only didn't serve them but was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing!”
Reviews.Author: nutellawunder
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Hyatt Regency for 3 nights and was surprised about the lack of service I met. Usually service is very good in the US and people are very friendly, but this is not the case at the Hyatt Regency. The tidying up of the room was very sloppy, there was no toilet paper when I arrived, the reception as well as the concierge was regularly not manned and getting a smile out of any one of their employees was a real challenge. So, nice location, good crab cakes but awful service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: sbbenson
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with an excellent location. It is right across the Baltimore Inner Harbor and the many restaurants/attractions in the area. However, the price was slightly high. The room (King) was clean, nicely decorated, comfortable bed. I had a inner-harbor view room with a great view. This is not the most quietest hotel. If you are a light sleeper, request the top floor, away from the elevators facing opposite of the harbor. Baltimore Fire Station 1 is down the street and I was awakened multiple times by siren. I would certainly stay again, however, would not face the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “hyatt is a decent hotel trying to be mediocre”
Reviews.Author: carolsmiles
Reviews.Content: Hyatt hotels are usually a safe bet; however, this Hyatt failed to meet even our basic expectations. The lobby and Bistro 300 were nice -- location was fantastic across from the Inner Harbor, but our room was sorely outdated and in dire need of a renovation. The view was horrible (adjacent rooftop) and the mini couch had stains all over it . They didn't even provide additional toiletries the second day. Also, the "free" internet for the business room deal I had was not accessible and the bill via the TV was not working. Little details such as these made our $200 plus per night hotel room in a four star hotel feel more like a cheap $80 per night Holiday Inn. The free breakfast (provided with our room rate) was the only redeeming thing about this whole stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service, No Follow Through, Do NOT plan any special occasions here...”
Reviews.Author: LindyJJohnson
Reviews.Content: I booked one night at this hotel for our wedding anniversary. I had requested a room on a high floor with a nice view. On arrival they gave us a room on the 7th floor (there are 14), with a direct view of the backside of the convention center and alley. I called and spoke with hotel staff who said she could transfer us to a Harborview at no charge on the 14th floor. She said our luggage would be waiting in our new room when we came back from the aquarium, and offered a complimentary bottle of champagne to be delivered at 9pm and left in the room if we weren't back from dinner. This seemed very nice, and I was impressed. However, 3 hours later after the aquarium, when I explained this to the evening staff, they had to search the database to find a room that was on the 11th floor and half the size of our original room...it was very claustrophobic! We got up there and our luggage was not there either. So I called down again. The evening staff was courteous and offered to show us a room with more space on the 6th floor, but had 2 double beds. This is NOT what we wanted for our anniversary, but at that time, he said the entire hotel was full and checked in, and there were no other queen/king beds available. Disappointed, we accepted the other room (which did have a nice view), but then had to wait for our luggage to be brought up and missed our dinner reservations. Finally, we went to get dinner later than expected and on return at 10pm, there was no complimentary champagne waiting as had been offered. We ended up sleeping in separate beds (on our anniversary) because the double beds were so small, and neither of us got any rest. Overall the entire experience was disappointing, and I regret booking an anniversary evening at the Hyatt. I do not understand why a nicer room was not saved for us when we had requested it. Furthermore, if they wanted to help compensate for this and move us to a nicer room, why did they offer one on the 14th floor with complimentary champagne, then not follow through? As a local Baltimorean, I will make sure to pass my experience on to others not to visit your establishment, especially for any formal events. I truly hope this was a onetime experience and that this is not normal business operation.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jlc81
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel with an excellent location. It is right across the Baltimore Inner Harbor and the many restaurants/attractions in the area. It is one of the hotels that I stay in when I visit Baltimore for work. The staff is friendly and willing to help when asked. The security feature of inserting a key card to access the floors with the guest rooms is kind of cumbersome ... especially with luggage ... but reassuring. The rate for self parking is comparable to the other hotels in the area ($27/day) and the rate for internet is $9.95/day. I have not encountered any issues with housekeeping. Room service delivers within the specified time. I agree with the other reviews that the soundproofing of the rooms is not very good. When someone walks past the door or when someone in the room next/above you uses/flushes the bathroom, you can hear them. I have not heard people talking in the next room but I like to turn on the TV to provide white noise and tune out the other noises. The furniture in a couple of the rooms also look a little dingy. Overall, I think that it is a good place to stay for its location and easy access to the Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SBJBlue
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel thru Priceline for a great price! Booked for a night for my husbands birthday. Upon check in the clerk said they had a room for us with 2 double beds, so I asked him if they had any king rooms left.... he said no, but then proceeded to check for me and found us one! Our room was on the 14th floor with a harbor view, beautiful! Had an awesome very modern bathroom with a large shower (no bathtub). Thank you check in desk clerk!!! We ate breakfast the next morning at the Bistro restaurant. They have a buffet for about $18 a person or they have a menu to order from. We ended up getting the buffet, as the al la carte menu would have been about the same price. Even though we got there at the tail end of the buffet serving time, the food was plentiful, hot, and very good! The hotel is directly across the street from Harborplace via an overhead walkway so it was very convenient to shop, or site see. All in all, we enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt, especially for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Great, spacious getaway on the Harbor”
Reviews.Author: MattyBsouL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this at the very last minute (8:00pm) through priceline. We checked in at 10:30 that night and were treated very warmly by the staff. The entire lobby area looked very sleak (even the elevators had flat screen tv's) and our room was very clean & spacious with a nice flat screen tv and very spacious shower. Our only minor complaint is the toilet that sounds like an airplane toilet when its flushed. That's one good way to wake up a room at 4am. We also decided against room service after seeing how expensive everything from the restaurant was, especially when $3.00 + 20% is added on. Very small flaws in an otherwise enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bagdragger
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the best location in Baltimore, with great views of the inner harbor area. Friendly staff, clean, modern rooms, and good food in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and modern Hyatt on the Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl41184
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt Regency in Baltimore. I booked through hotwire and got a great deal. The hotel was in an excellent (albeit touristy) location on the inner-harbor and was definitely a great deal considering how little we paid through hotwire. Compliments: - The lobby, elevators, and overall hotel amenities: modern, clean, very spacious (loved the views from elevator!) - My room was very nice and modern with gorgeous views of harbor - The hotel bar (bistro 335 I think) was great with decent (and not too pricey) wine selection - Starbucks on second floor – very much appreciated! - The front desk, housekeeping, and concierge were excellent on Friday and Saturday night: super-accommodating, friendly, helpful, etc. - The location: one of the only hotels actually on the inner-harbor and also really convenient to everything central in Baltimore Complaints: - The bed: teeeeny pillows, and no inner sheet, just a tucked in (tiny!) sheet covering mattress, which would not stay on! waking up on a hotel mattress is not pleasant. - The front desk, housekeeping, and concierge on Sunday night were awful! (Didn’t clean room until asked twice; concierge had no recommendations for a nice Italian restaurant (weird); front desk seemed to be always vacant, ...) It seemed like the great staff went home Sunday night and a terrible staff filled-in! I understand Sunday is a less busy night but we are paying the same rate so I expect the same service.... - Internet and parking were really pricey... although somewhat expected from big, corporate hotel in decent sized city Anyway, overall I would recommend this hotel if you are looking to stay at a modern, big hotel on the inner harbor. I'd consider staying there again if I was in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Cost”
Reviews.Author: Jmacq1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night over the Columbus Day weekend on a leisure trip for some sightseeing and a local convention. The Hotel has a superb location for sightseeing in and around the Inner Harbor, but they're charging four-star prices for (at best) three-star accommodations. Or simply charging for convenience above all else. Their Bistro 300 restaurant was "OK" but overpriced for both dinner and especially breakfast. The room was reasonably clean and spacious, though the beds were not very comfortable and the hotel in general is extremely noisy (certainly not soundproofed walls and floors). For the price being paid, I would have expected more in the way of amenities, or at least free parking or breakfast. If a convenient location is your top priority, then I'd heartily recommend this hotel, but if you're looking for a top-notch experience all-around, I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hyatt in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelingalot
Reviews.Content: I ussually stay at Hyatts, so it was no suprise on this biz trip that the Hyatt Baltimore was a clean and delightful hotel. Parking was expensive and the hotel is definatley requires a car, but since the Marriott Downtown was full this was a nice option and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “View is good and the room was clean”
Reviews.Author: MikeJones007
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for 1 night but we had a good time. I knew that parking would be extra so it was not a surprise (it's a city, you have to pay to park). Room was very clean and staff was friendly. I would go back if I was in the area. Lots of places to go see in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Impeccable Service, Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: JSMbktnr
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed for a single night in the Hyatt Regency in Baltimore and were more than impressed with out choice. The Hyatt is in the perfect location for those wishing to visit the Inner Harbor, go to a game at Camden Yards, and/or attend an event at the Convention Center. We decided beforehand to use Valet Parking, as the price was very similar to that of Self-parking. The valet service was impeccable and prompt. We did valet parking for the day, and although we checked out at 10AM, we were allowed to keep our car there without any additional charge till 5pm. This effectively allowed for 2 full days of parking, while we enjoyed ourselves in the Inner Harbor. I have always wanted to go to a Ruths Chris Steakhouse. The Front Desk called in our reservations, gave us incredibly easy-to-follow directions, and upon our return- asked us how our experience was as we walked through their automatic rotating door. Hands Down, this was the best Hotel stay I have ever had. When going to Baltimore's Inner Harbor, there really is only one GREAT option.

Reviews.Title: “The 2007 renovation didn't last long . . .”
Reviews.Author: NH_Guy
Reviews.Content: A tired, worn-out convention hotel that has seen better days. Even a stay on the Club floor was disappointing. The rooms are cramped, the hallways noisy, and the service is almost non-existent. Almost 5 hours to get the room made up (5 hours after a call requesting the service, that is); a Club room that ran out of amenites every day of our stay, and was often not re-stocked; and generally unengaged staff for whatever else one might need. The 2007 renovation changed the colors and the carpets, perhaps, but this aging hotel needed a good deal more to be competitive in the Inner Harbor market.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for Everything in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: RoadTripper516
Reviews.Content: Although my usual favorite place to stay in Baltimore is the Marriot Waterfront, we managed to get an unbelievable deal on a room at the Hyatt Regency Baltimore Inner Harbor on Labor Day weekend for under $100 through an online discounter. We asked for a waterview room and got Room 746 (a corner room) that had two entire walls of glass facing Inner Harbor and also overlooking the 6th floor rooftop pool, poolside bar and tennis courts. The room was cozy and ample sized, with a small sitting area and desk/office space. Comfortable beds, plenty of storage space, nice size bathroom, many sundries/mini-bar/coffee and toiletries. The housekeeping staff and front desk staff were extremely friendly. The bellman and doorman were functional. The parking staff was even very accomodating. About parking.......If you drive to this hotel you have two options: Valet parking at $36 a day or self-park at $27. "Make sure you get your parking card as soon a you check in for self-parking" so you don't pay more than the daily rate if you are going in and out of the lot in the same day. Your parking charge covers you until 5 pm on your check out day, in case you want to do more sightseeing or have a late flight. Unless you have to drive somewhere, the hotel is very convenient to all Baltimore attractions without using your car. You can safely cross the boulevard to the Inner Harbor shops and restaurants by an elevated walkway. Once there, you can use the water taxi system to get to other areas like Fells Point. The hotel is also linked by elevated walkways to the Convention Center. The pool was a nice outdoor oasis and is open Memorial Day to Labor Day each year. Great stay, excellent staff and perfect location!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: YoungBuckTravel
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed at they Hyatt after some long deliberation between this hotel and the brand new Hilton. I can say that I was definately grateful to have picked the Hyatt. This hotel is nice, clean, and convenient to anyone looking to do the inner harbor activities. The aquarium is a lot of fun though the Dolphin Show is sort of short and disappointed myself and fiance. The location was perfect. There is a pedestrian bridge that connects you to the harbor through the mall. It was nice not having to worry about the traffic. The rooms were nice and clean. The bathrooms had a nice distinct look to them. The beds were amazing and with a few drinks you won't have to count many sheep until your fast asleep. We didn't get a view of the harbor but it really didn't matter since we only went back at night to sleep. The staff was very curteous at the front desk. The parking was quite expensive at $27 a day. The Hilton is much farther away and even though it looks close on the map. be prepared for a hike. The Hyatt is definately a nice hotel and we would recommend it to those who are looking for a nice hotel at the Inner Harbor

Reviews.Title: “OK for a stop over”
Reviews.Author: RallyMonkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a one night stop over to catch an Orioles game. It is ideally placed for that, within walking distance of the stadium, and on game days there are a lot of people around, so it felt quite safe. There is a good sized car cark next to the hotel, and self parking is not a problem. Check in was quick and the rooms clean and ok for one night. The hotel is a little noisy and breakfast was poor to average but no waits. The only real negative was the bath which was so shallow that it could only really be used as a shower. Ok for one night, but don't expect luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: rcapolete
Reviews.Content: Took my Wife and 2 small kids to the Hyatt Regency from 8/21-8/23. Couldn't ask for a better hotel. The location was perfect, the staff was polite and efficient. Had a small issue with the people in the room next to us arguing and the Hotel handled it perfect. They compensated us for the issue with a coupon for 2 adult to the breakfast buffet. Can't blame the hotel for people like were next to us but you can hold them responsible for how they handle it and we couldn't ask for a better response on their part. Will definetly be stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to stay - Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: youarenosy
Reviews.Content: It is a very lively and active location but giving consideration to the fact that it is at the Harbor this only makes sense. It is a wondefful hotel and an ideal place to stay when spending an evening or two at the Harbor. Breakfast Buffet is a tad bit to pricey, but outside of that I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful but NOISY”
Reviews.Author: wandina
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 1230 on Saturday, 8 Aug and room was ready, wonderful to be able to check-in and park before 2:00 tickets at the Aquarium. Room on the 12th floor was nicely laid out and clean. Pillows were toooo soft, bed was decent, bathroom clean but only two washclothes and reservation was a room for 5 people. The bad, now the hotel has no balconies, the windows are floor to ceiling, a group must have been having a party in their room, heard entire conversation, constant laughing, as if they were on a balcony right outside of our window. Walls/windows are EXTREMELY thin. Would I stay at this hotel again, yes. Aside from that slight irritation, ended around 1000, I think it is well worth it for the location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Not a quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: a_good_night_sleep
Reviews.Content: I heard sirens all night long. Guests were loud also. Parking was pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: NateWooding
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel even though I came here for a single night. The rooms were modern and I loved the elevators!!! You should really come here.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: KChaplinsky
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt because it was the only hotel I found in the inner-harbor that had a pool. The pool was run-down, and the poolside drink/snack cabana was closed the day I visited (although the weather was perfect. maybe they were understaffed?). Check-in was a breeze, and the woman that helped us was so sweet. BEWARE: I just checked my online banking information and discovered that I was billed twice. Visa informed me that I'll have to wait for my bill to appear, and then I'll have to manually fill out a form and send it in to dispute the charge (may not seem like a big deal, but I love the ease of doing things online, so this makes me a little cranky). Since the transaction is still pending, Visa told me I could call the Hyatt and ask them to revoke it. I just got off the phone with the hotel operator, and the ONLY department that can assist me is the accounting department, which is not open until Monday. Will never stay here again, and I advise that you avoid the hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: nsb06751
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in July. We received a price of $65 on Priceline. I was disappointed we could not get a king bed and it was explained that they were $50 more per night. Bummer. The room we had was 559, fifth floor facing Camden Yards with virtually no view although it was quiet. The location is convenient to the waterfront. We opted to purchase the Water Taxi day pass which was a very enjoyable way to see the sites around the harbor. Some places we visited off the taxi and would recommend are the Visionary Museum, Fort McHenry and Fells Point. Restaurants we enjoyed included Bill's Terrace Inn and Obrycki's for steamed crab. Bill's uses a Old Bay base for seasoning while Obrycki's uses a pepper based seasoning. Bertha's Mussels (Fells Point) was ok. We had the Mussels with Anchovy, Sun dried Tomato and Garlic sauce for dipping. Mama's on the Half Shell was wonderful. I recommend the Crab Cake at Mama's. Fantastic. We did have a car so we were able to drive to some of the farther destinations. We will be back to Baltimore!

Reviews.Title: “This is NOT a 4 Star hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: MsTravelerSF
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in June 2009. Expectations (and price!) were for a 4 star hotel, but I would rate as a 2.5. The Good: Newly remodeled with great view if you pay for the HarborView rooms, which we did. The Bad: TV did not work, and once it was fixed, limited stations. Radio did not work. Iron was broken and made me late each day. Very poor housekeeping - shower was cleaned only 1 out of the 3 days and floor was not cleaned. Bedding was cleaned only 1 of the 3 days - found articles left in the bed after being made! Food at Bistro Cafe was poor and pricey. Coffee bar was not open as stated - closed when I went at 6:10 AM and at 5:30PM. Workout room was suppose to be open 24 hrs, but found it locked and was told it's closed Fri & Sat nights??? The visitor information they provided was wrong and ended up going to the Visitors Center across the street. Cost to use Internet, when I get it free at Hilton Garden Inn! Next time you will find me at the Marriott or Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: notsolatethistime
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel, it was extremely noisy though- I couldnt sleep a wink when I was on level 6 because of the terrible terrible acoustics from the bar and the ensuiing hoovering and cleaning of the hotel. The reception staff moved me to a fabulous king room on level 12 overlooking the harbour , it was wonderful except it had no bath which I was disappointed about. The staff were really very nice and I had great room service, not too pricey. I would recommend not staying on levels up to level 6 as there is a ceiling that traps all the noise in from the open plan hotel. The conference rooms were average and you could barely hear our speakers for the noise in the room next door. The business centre was incredibly expensive. I had to pay for WiFi in my room which I think is ridiculous. Food was very average.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: Snoog82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt inner harbor. Our room which was club level was perfect with a perfect view and well worth the money. The front desk was not only friendly but helpful in every way. I can say to all: stay, tour the fort, walk the inner harbor, enjoy all Baltimore has to offer.. which was a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but uninspiring”
Reviews.Author: urmed02
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 3rd floor of the Hyatt for a conference at the Baltimore Convention center. Although I was on the Harbor side, my view was of the buildings across the street. Room was nice (two doubles...they were out of rooms with a king!) and bathroom clean, but nothing really told me I was staying at a Hyatt. I could have been in any other nondescript hotel room. The staff were nice, the lobby comfortable. If I had to do it all over, I would have stayed a few blocks further away from the harbor at the Hilton which looked AMAZING (and had great views of Camden Yards) and was a few dollars cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and great location”
Reviews.Author: Canuck99999
Reviews.Content: Nice stylish hotel with excellent view. Close to harbour and nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels I've been to”
Reviews.Author: ziggyziggy
Reviews.Content: I was there for a long weekend getaway. The woman at the front desk upgraded us to a special deluxe room with water view. Let me tell you, the room was amazing!!! It was a corner room with floor to ceiling glass on two sides and we can view the harbor and the financial district and the galleria mall across the street. The view was absolutely stunning. The hotel is beautiful and classy and very close to everything within Inner Harbour. The only downside is the expensive parking but its expected since its such a classy hotel in the middle of a major city. Parking on the streets is hard so its worth the price. It was about $20 a day but I forget. Overall, the hotel is beautiful as there is nothing less expected from Hyatts.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Antarctic
Reviews.Content: Excellent location overlooking the harbour area. Stunning hotel externally with dark glass covering the outside walls. Service was patchy with the concierge one of the best around but the serving staff at breakfast disinterested. Food at breakfast was just average. The rooms were spacious, bed comfortable and my room was clean. The major downside of this hotel is that it was possibly one of the noisiest I have ever stayed in. Noise came in from the corridor, adjacent rooms and around the window frames from rooms above and below. There appeared to be no sound insulation anywhere in my room and all conversations and activities in adjoining rooms could be heard clearly - even when the conversation was at a subdued level. This complaint was also levied by other colleagues who had to stay in the place for 2 weeks. I would try the adjacent Sheraton, Marriott, Hilton or Renaissance if I had to visit Baltimore again. I would not stay at this Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, great location”
Reviews.Author: westinhyatt
Reviews.Content: The HYATT REGENCY was in a great waterfront location. The lobby was impresive. The rooms were spacious and comfy. If you had a water view the view was great. You could see across the water. It was near to market and the water. It was a clean hotel. The service was good and it was great value like most HYATT REGENCY'S are. If you were staying in Baltimore the HYATT, MARRIOTT,RENAISSANCE, SHERATON and INTERCONTINENTAL are brilliant waterfront hotels in beautiful Baltimore one of my favorite city's.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: ohio2007
Reviews.Content: Everyone we encountered at the Hyatt was pleasant and helpful. Wanted to check in early, but a King room was not available. So we went over to Inner Harbor (loved easy access on overhead walkways.) When we returned a room was available, great view of the harbor. Room was clean and updated with flatscreen TV. We requested extra towels a couple of times (we were there 2 nights) and housekeeping brought them immediately. Concierge helped us out with dinner reservations. Valets were friendly and helpful with directions. I was concerned after reading some negative reviews here. We did not experience any problems. Parking price was expected, leaving our car in the garage Saturday at noon until Monday at 8am cost $54. That was our only extra expense here. The Aquarium was wonderful and whomever said the 4-D movie is a must, thank you! You were right!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View, Great Amenities, Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: Sycamore72
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Baltimore for a quick weekend getaway. We chose the Hyatt for the location. When we got there, the woman at the front desk, Patricia, was there all by herself with a full hotel and handled the situation with ease. She even called us when our room was ready for early check in (130). When we got to the hotel, we were told that we were upgraded and that the hotel was full. We were given the penthouse 3-room, 2-bathroom suite that was simply amazing. A Bose stereo surround sound, 2 flatscreens, wetbar, bathroom with shower, jacuzzi and bidet. The view is the best in the Inner Harbor and all of the staff were very friendly, from the front desk to the maids. I can't wait to go back. The only negative was that the street noise was surprisingly loud, even 14 floors up.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay in the Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: stacey246
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the price we got on this hotel. We booked it through Priceline and got it for a lot cheaper than the advertised rate. We needed a hotel between the Harbor and Camden Yards and this was a great location for us. We did some sightseeing in the Inner Harbor and took in a game at the Yards. I would definitely go back to the hotel. It had a lot of amenities and we really enjoyed the champagne brunch on the top of the hotel overlooking the Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Even gave them a second chance”
Reviews.Author: Optimistic1
Reviews.Content: Two months ago I had a corner room (non harbor view) that was spacious BUT the entryway smelled like a dirty bathroom. The comforter on the bed had a body imprint on it, and the ice bucket had water still in the bottom of it. I expressed all of this during my stay. I went back on Valentine's Day to a Harbor View room with no discount from the previous bad stay. The room was short two towels, the trash can had paper doilies in the bottom that were filthy, and appeared as if they just placed a new cleaner one over the dirty ones each time (no bag in the can). Saturday morning, I went to make coffee and fond that the water reservoir was filthy. It had several rings of dust around the interior and was NOT something that I would dare use. Final Note: On Valentine's day the hotel told me when I checked in that they were booked full that night yet, there were only two receptionists working the counter (out of 6 possible). The line was at least 20 couples long still at 5 PM on Valentines Day. This hotel had later check in than usual(4PM) as it was and was understaffed for the guests upon check in on a day that I am sure many guests had dinner plans and reservations to keep. This was the second visit with a sub standard room, and a managerial issue with needing more staffing. There were 5 valets, and only two desk workers. What's the point of rushing people into a hotel lobby if they will just wait in a long line?

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: umdterp08
Reviews.Content: This is a great location near the Inner Harbor - very convenient. I've lived near Baltimore almost my entire life and it's a great city. The hotel is nice, rooms are clean and comfortable. The service is good, but not excellent. Like another review I've read about Hyatt - you know what you're in for. You pay for what you get. The Hyatt is no different. The rooms are clean and comfortable and most likely spacious. The hotel is almost always very nice. The service is almost always excellent. I've stayed at numerous Hyatt hotels and I'm never disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but Unremarkable”
Reviews.Author: Mlogs
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency is well located at Baltimore's Inner Harbor. It is easy and enjoyable to walk to all the area restaurants. The harbor view from the room is wonderful but will add an additional $25 to your room rate. The rooms are comfortable but attention to detail seems not to be the strong suit of this property. The wallpaper in my bathroom was noticeably stained next to the door and the caulking on the sing had partial peeled away (RM 1206). The staff at the Hyatt were friendly and courteous from the desk, to the maids, to the parking attendant. I did have one negative experience that had nothing to do with attitude. I was having trouble setting up the in room wireless internet ($10), when the desk agent could not figure out the problem she told me to call T-Mobile. Not a huge issue but not what I am looking for when paying close to $300 a night. If you are considering staying at this hotel you will likely have a fine stay without incident, though it will not be anything to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: dwus5178
Reviews.Content: Great Place, Great location.The staff is accomodating and personable.The rooms are comfortable and clean.It's attached to the inner harbor and a short walk to Camden Yards and M&T Stadium

Reviews.Title: “Great location and view of the inner harbour”
Reviews.Author: crazywudsl
Reviews.Content: Came here with friends and received adjoining rooms as requested. The rooms were very spacious with one room being sorta suite like with sitting area as we were in the corner of the building. Location was excellent as we were connected to the inner harbour shops via a crosswalk which made it so we didn't have to cross the street. Outdoor pool was relatively nice and the overall impressions of the lobby and building were positive. Relatively clean with adequate furnishings all around. Service at the concierge desk was friendly and adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Hyatt Guest”
Reviews.Author: NJ_Steve
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt for only one night but would definitely stay again! My partner and I drove to Baltimore for a two-day getaway and we booked the Hyatt via their website. We were able to get a AAA discount PLUS FREE BUFFET BREAKFAST for two (a $30 dollar savings). There is a parking lot attached to the garage (valet or self-park). Parking cost us $27, but this is a downtown city, so not bad when we split the cost. Check-in was fast and the front desk very friendly. We even got to check-in a few hours early. We visited the National Aquarium, which was terrific; don't miss the 4-D movie, which costs extra but worth it for the amusement park thrill effects (they have attraction-type movies at Universal Studios and Disney too). We did the Inner Harbor tourist walking and shopping on day two. The Hyatt room is fabulous--very comfortable beds with luxury bedding and pillows. This IS a Hyatt Regency after all. The room has a nice LCD TV, a mini bar, and spacious bathroom which was very clean (I hate mold on bathroom tiles). Since we were in Baltimore for one night, we had dinner at the Rusty Scupper (B+) and dessert at the Bistro 300 (inside the Hyatt). It was raining all day and night (perfect for being indoors at the Aquarium), so we took a taxi to the restaurant ($5 way). The buffet breakfast the next morning was very good, especially since they will cook you an egg omelet to order (included in the buffet price). Being "free", it was worth it--even if they don't have any desserts (danish and some pastries, but no cake). Luckily, the second day was hot and sunny so we took a Water Taxi ($9 per person for all day access) to Fells Point. After walking for an hour, we headed back to the Inner Harbor. Fells Point is a waste of time, unless you like musty bars and bums, but we wanted to check it out because a friend told us it has "atmosphere" (so does Mars, but you can't breathe there without choking). The Hyatt layout and staff are very accommodating -- the lobby is 3 floors, fun to explore and sit on sofas, watching the crowds across the street at the Harborplace. We loved the glass elevators that let you look out over the harbor as you rise 15 floors to the top (floors 4-15 look out towards the harbor). Reminded me of the Mel Brooks movie "High Anxiety" but still a great view, especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay!”
Reviews.Author: edved23
Reviews.Content: The Baltimore Hyatt Regency is a fine option on the Inner Harbor. My stay was pleasant and relaxing. We had a spacious corner room on the 5th floor. The location of the hotel is ideal for the Harbor area and close to the ballpark. Positives Clean room Nice bathroom Nice view from top floor bar Access to Harbor Proximity to Camden Yards Disliked Lobby is cluttered Wifi seemed to come in and out. All in all a pleasant stay. I would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury On The Inner Harnbor, Defnetly Worth Staying At!”
Reviews.Author: MrRoboto737
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt brand is name that just scream one word, Luxury. While in Baltimore, their is nothing better than this hotel.
