It has a great atrium, that you can just spend hours just sitting on one of the comfortable sofas, admiring.The Bistro 300 has a lovely ambiance that makes anyone feel more than welcomed. The Rooms are very spacious, and the beds are more than comfortable. the Tvs are all flat paneled, with all the channels, even HBO. Its a 5 min walk from Camden yards, and ravens stadium. The Concierge staff is very helpful for anything. The hotel is stationed near the aquarium, which makes a great family outing. With beautiful harbor views and a wonder staff, and great rooms, the Hyatt Regency Baltimore is a great hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: broomea
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt for 2 nights (8/1-8/3). Great location to all the sites, restaurants and bars. As stated earlier, towel racks/bars are nonexistent in bathroom. Beds were comfy. Had drinks one night at the Pisces restaurant in the hotel on th 14th floor. Great view on the Inner Harbor. I would not hesitate to return to this hote. Can't beat the location and the friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service Experience”
Reviews.Author: rdw930
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for a week from 7/21 – 7/26 while attending a Conference at the Baltimore Convention Center. The hotel was clean and the staff was nice, as we would expect. What really set this trip apart, and justified me giving them the above average rating, was that my wife and I decided to dine one evening in the Bistro 300 restaurant located in the hotel due to a terrible storm. While we were dining water started to drip behind my wife’s chair from a leak in the ceiling, splashing her very slightly. The server moved us to another table and neither of us thought twice about it as we understand that it was out of their control. The next evening room service was at the door with a fruit tray, cheese and crackers, and a chilled bottle of wine. The items were accompanied by a hand written apology letter from the hotel manager (I think it was the food manager). I had paid with my credit card and had not added the bill to my room and so the manager apparently took the time to research my name and figure out what room I was in. I thought this was very good customer service as it didn’t even really drip on us. I would recommend them for this reason, as I now believe that they always have their guest’s satisfaction at heart!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: annevictoria
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June for a wedding, so we got a heavily discounted room rate. Rooms were nice - comfy beds. As a previous poster said - they need to put in towel bars in the bathroom. Also, the towels are chinzy. I expected a much better quality towel from the Hyatt. The beds are comfortable and there is plenty of space in the room. The staff here was excellent. They were so accomodating and went the extra mile for you. The food in their restaurants and for the wedding was excellent. The breakfast buffet at the Bistro is a little pricey, but there really are not any other breakfast options nearby. Lunch and appetizers were excellent - especially the quesadillas! At night enjoy drinks at Pisces on the top floor and enjoy a great view of Inner Harbor. Overall, you cannot beat the location and the staff is excellent. Would stay here again if we were to return to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Renovation!”
Reviews.Author: CrazyFoodieGuy
Reviews.Content: For me, when it comes to hotels the number one priority is cleanliness. I don't get bothered too much by bad service, or lousy restaurants, or slightly poor location. But all I ask for in any city I go to is a CLEAN room! So many issues with our room primarily in the bathroom (which is the one area that HAS to be clean): 1) toilet was so high powered that it sprayed water out of the toilet 2) tissue box on sink was covered in mildew 3) shower had more mildew on the floor and corners 4) towels smelled The bedroom was large and comfortable and the view was nice. Location was good although I think the Renaissance would have been a slightly better location. Only other issue was the walls were a little thin...and it seemed like the hotel was really empty....so why don't they got to put their guests so close together. If all other Hyatts are like this, I will defnly go with other chains instead.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: lisajl
Reviews.Content: The kids and I just got back from a 3 night stay at the Hyatt. The hotel decor was beautiful, sort of asian inspired, with lovely bamboo and other greenery in the common areas. The color scheme was soothing earth tones. The glass elevator was a hit with the kids-as it rises past the 4th floor it is now on the outside of the hotel with a stunning view of the inner harbor. Our room was spacious enough and the furnishings were contemporary, with blue and brown colors. The beds and pillow were incredibly comfortable. We all slept well. The hotel pool, fitness club, and jacuzzi were nice, if a little small. We noticed, though, that in the evening the pool doesn't get much sun. During the day it was quite sunny there and they had music playing.We enjoyed it. They also have tennis courts adjacent to the pool. All of the hotel staff we met were very pleasant and helpful. We had room service one night. The portions were generous and food was very good. A couple of things to note-I would have liked a newspaper in front of my door in the morning, but that is for gold members only. They leave a stack outside the elevators so you can take one there. They charge for internet use-5.95 for 10 minutes. That seemed expensive, but I don't travel that often, so maybe that is standard. The pool bar and food service is only open on the weekends. I had to go down a few floors to the bistro to get drinks and bring them back to the pool. We enjoyed our stay very much. To note: There is a skywalk to the inner harbor just past the gift shop. Very convienient!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: psarro
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel, the location is so pretty, easy to find and has parking. The staff was helpful and friendly. The housekeeper was on the floor when we arrived and we asked her for some additional towels and other things which she gave us and even asked if needed anything else before she finished her rounds. The rooms are spacious, nicely decorated and clean. I have been to other Hyatts and this is one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: WWDWD
Reviews.Content: After checking in, I was told we would have a newspaper delivered each day since we are Hyatt Gold members, but that never happened. I am still not a big fan that Hyatt charges for Wi-Fi, even for its' Gold members, especially at the prices they charge. The food was alright, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic!!!”
Reviews.Author: P.Jordan
Reviews.Content: From the minute we stepped into the Hyatt the staff was there with a smile and a welcome. The Inner Harbor with so much action and entertainment is really just steps away via an overpass from the hotel. Our room over looked the harbor and I don’t know what I enjoyed more waking up to the harbor view or going to bed seeing all the lights. The bed – ah, comfort at its best. Don’t miss the breakfast buffet; it is wonderful and the pool is a perfect place to rest and relax. The only thing I would change is the price of parking. If you are staying at the hotel I really think it should be half of what they charge. Don’t hesitate though – call the Hyatt and try the roof top dining.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better Inner Harbor Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Phantom03
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here over Memorial Day weekend. We go to the Inner Harbor at least once every year and have stayed at a variety of hotels in the area. Most of the hotels in the Downtown/Inner Harbor section are old and don't have many of the modern luxuries found in other areas of the country. The Hyatt isn't quite as old as some of the others, but it is old enough to show some of it's age. To the hotel's credit, we found the rooms to be clean and at least partially renovated. We found the service to be generally excellent and the location really cannot be beat for access to the Inner Harbor shops and entertainment. If you are lucky enough to get a harbor view room you'll love the view. It is expensive to be sure, but almost every hotel in that area is (especially when the Red Sox or Yankees are in town). Worth it? Probably not, but you won't find many bargains that offer similar amenities, service and location. I'll try not to be too windy on this review so here goes... Pros: Location, location, location!, including a foot bridge over the street to the Inner Harbor shops. Excellent & friendly service (except for housekeeping). Flat screen HD TV with swivel base so you can view from anywhere in the room. Long multi-sectional low ottoman against the windows to sit and enjoy the view. Comfortable beds. Perfect amount of white noise from the A/C and good temperature control. Fast responding glass elevators. Large in room safe. Strong flush toilets & good shower. Portable phone. Individual cup coffee maker. Cons: Parking is outrageously expensive if you use the hotel's valet/self park. The "Do Not Disturb" sign is very hard to find (it's a very tiny gray card in a plastic sleeve behind the door bar). We were awakened several times by housekeeping until we found it while getting ready to check out. Housekeeping must not have liked us either because our room was not made up timely nor was it properly restocked. Exterior noise was a definite concern. Small closet with few hangers. Small bathroom. Poor lighting. Yes there are several cons, material ones at that, but I can say from experience that almost all of the Inner Harbor area hotels have these problems and many more. It is above average for the AREA it is in, not by world traveler standards, where it would only be average.

Reviews.Title: “OK - nothing special”
Reviews.Author: ctcomanchepilot
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend of May 30-Jun1 here on a baseball trip. This hotel was VERY expensive - its Baltimore after all. Everything else was very expensive as well. We booked a room on the Club floor expecting fine amenities as is the case at every other supposedly 4-5 star hotel we have stayed in. Not the case here. Beer / Wine were chargeable items on the club floor. I have NEVER stayed on a club floor where they charged for anything. Food selections were 'ok,' but usually ran out quickly and the 'concierge' there spent most of her time either talking on the phone or talking with people who obviously co-workers and workers and friends in the lounge. The bed was Hyatt comfortable - service was inconsistent. First nite, turn down service, next night, not. Called for towels, got one. Requested extra towels in advance - it was confirmed - got none. We had a free breakfast rate and the buffet was typical hotel buffet. You could order eggs special and it took 25m to get 2 eggs over easy and coffee refills were untimely as well - too few employees working. Yet if you got up to get coffee the matre'd would come over and tell you you could not serve yourself, and they'd be right over - 10 min later. Overall - for what we paid, we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place w/ great service”
Reviews.Author: SisterSmitty
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about the Hyatt Regency Inner Harbor. The customer service was excellent, the hotel was spotless and the location was perfect. We spent 5 nights there and had a flawless experience. I am most impressed at how the staff really understands customer service. They are clearly great people with the ability to handle questions and concerns without making the guest feel like an imposition. Everyone was knowledgeable about their amenities and the city. The location is great, with a walkway over to the Inner Harbor. Just a 2 minute walk and you are in the center of activities, restaurants and music. The rooms are beautiful, with luxurious linens, flat screen tv's and wall-to-wall windows. Amazingly, I rarely heard any noise from the hallways. In 5 days I might have heard a handful of noises at all. I never heard bathroom noise from another room, despite their toilets being "power assisted" and thus very loud. The large windows let in some street noise, but less than I have heard in some other hotel rooms. Given that it is right on a major road, it is understandable. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unusually noisy”
Reviews.Author: PlanesTrainsAutos4
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Baltimore for the Memorial Day holiday. We were in town to visit family and go to a Yankees/Orioles game. This hotel is pretty average. The staff is friendly... check in and storing our bags before and after check in was no problem and the service was quick on a holiday weekend. The room we had was a king with a partial view of the pool which was nothing special. There was plenty of room, lots of tables and a nice seating area all along the window wall. Bed was comfortable, everything worked, the bathroom had a nice vanity and shelf for all our toiletries. However, the walls must be the thinnest ever. You can hear not only toilets flushing and showers running in the rooms on either side of you but you can easily hear normal voices across the hall, in the other room with both doors closed and the t.v. on. I also heard the elevator chime as it was stopping on our floor as clear as if I were standing in front of it and that was down the hall and around a corner. I can't comment on the restaurant here since it was closed for a wedding and brunch the next day but we did eat at the hotel's bistro for breakfast and it was average. All in all, it's a decent place in a convenient location for walking to most of the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but.....”
Reviews.Author: Cycleboy
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with others who have reviewed the Hyatt. The hotel is very nice and the staff is very friendly and accommodating, but..... There are little things that you shouldn't find at Hyatt, mostly just an attention to detail things. I stayed two nights when I attended a conference and while satisfied with things overall, there were little things that could have been better. Like: My room had not been thoroughly dusted, the desk was dusty, the lampshades were crooked. The coffee bar was not open one morning, then open the next day. I use a wheelchair and stayed in an accessible room, but it appeared that the room isn't used much (see above dusting comment). Rooms were not made up until very late (5:30) in the afternoon. I paid a conference rate for the room, which made the value OK, but if I paid full rate I would say that it would not be worth it. I do want to mention that the staff was excellent.. they addressed requests immediately, they always greeted you with a smile and were quite friendly. If they can address those small things, the hotel would be a much better experience. My one pet peeve, not just with the Hyatt, but most hotels... In an wheelchair accessible room, please make sure that the shower head is put in a lower position, if we have to use a wheelchair, that usually meansd we can't stand up to lower the shower....

Reviews.Title: “Bland Stay at a Routine, Unexceptional Chain Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Porpex
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hyatt Regency in Baltimore was unexceptional, and--at times--mildly irritating. Service can elevate a mediocre hotel into a great one, but the Hyatt is a bit lax. When I called the concierge to request a cab, I was told to call one myself, because I was at a third-party location. ("Can't you call one on my behalf?" I asked.) When the maid re-stocked my bathroom supplies, she left four bottles of shower gel, but failed to replenish the body lotion I'd used the night before. There was no turn-down service without formally requesting it, and my toilet even malfunctioned (although it was promptly repaired). After a day of sightseeing, we went to the bar about 5pm one afternoon. No bartender was on a duty, and a hapless but well-intentioned bus boy attempted to make our drinks, but botched 'em. (Eventually, an apologetic bartender did show up.) When I was ready to check out, the highly touted "in room video checkout" malfunctioned, and when I tried to check out via the computer terminals in the lobby, they were out-of-order, too. Some of these complaints may seem minor, but you certainly wouldn't encounter them at a Four Seasons or a Rosewood property. Unfortunately, neither company has a hotel in Baltimore. By default, the Hyatt Regency is highly touted as one of the city's best hotels. Sigh. One can only hope that the Ritz Carlton currently under construction will be able to bring genuine, four or five star service to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Hell at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: mk2008trips
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying that if you are looking for a hotel in the middle of the science center, the aquarium and the boat museums - this is a good location. It's a short walk to everything but location isn't everything. I honestly was expecting above average service for paying over $200 a night. This was by far the worst hotel experience i have ever had! We checked in Friday night to a room that smelled and was not cleaned so we were "upgraded". The new room was fine at first glance but then we noticed other problems - the air didn't work properly so although the thermostat said "60" (yes - i had to put the temp that low to even feel a hint of cool air) the vent was still blowing out warm air. The bed was a rock and the sheets were too starchy. The doors rattled as if someone were knocking whenever someone walked by which kept us up throughout the night. Speaking of which - the walls are paper thin...you hear everything. The shower drain didn't work so we had to shower in a pool of dirty water. Then to top it off the hotel pumps some god-awful air freshner that smells like some musty old basement. So - trying to leave?! Everyone and I mean everyone was trying to get out of that hotel at the same time. It took us 30 minutes just to move our car from our parking spot in the garage to the guy in the booth to pay. This hotel may have been the best of the best in it's hay-day but those days are long over. They made a very poor attempt to cover up poor service and poor quality with some fancy wallpaper and air freshners.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Pens4821
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Lobby is beautiful and everyone is extremely nice. Stayed in a room with 2 queens, and the beds were extremely comfortable. Rooms were "roomy" with a great TV. As others have said, could hear the doors slamming at all times, but the comfort more than made up for that. As for the location, couldn't ask for much more. Walk out the back exit on the 2nd floor and that puts you on a walkway right to the inner harbor (maybe a 3 minute walk) where there are plenty of things to do (shops, food, aquarium etc.). Go out that same exit and head the other way to Camden Yards (10-15 minute walk). We didn't even have to move our car which was great. Major downfall: parking. Forget how much, think it was $25, but when you are paying that much to stay a night, you would think they'd let you park for free or at least very discounted. Something else to see: If you like history, Fort McHenry is probably about 2 miles away. We walked it not knowing how far it was, but it really wasn't that bad. I would definately recommend to stay here. I plan on going back this summer and staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely Done Renovation of a Well Situated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: goroving
Reviews.Content: The mothballs are off the redone Hyatt at Baltimore's Inner Harbor and I, for one, am glad. My wife, my 13 yr. old and I visited on Christmas day for 2 nights and I was concerned about negative reviews. I had booked a travelzoo rate(about $50 less than the website's posted Christmas week rates, which are low for this location to begin with. The hotel had light traffic our two nights and this probably helped us from experiencing some of the negatives in other reviews. The entry lobby is a bit dissapointing and they need to add a restroom at this level. But doormen were friendly and check in was a breeze. The T-Zoo rate did not specify a view room from a non-view room, which was $40 additional on the websites non Tzoo rate. So, I was going to ask for a view room and was pleasantly surprised when this was offered up front. Our 10th floor room was off a very pleasant lobby done in tan shades. It is the same cookie cutter size of most big box hotels(i.e.-on the small side) but was opened up nicely by wall to wall, floor to ceiling windows, a setee that runs wall to wall by the window to allow sitting and observing the spectactular view of the harbor, and a large handsome mirror that dominates the center of the room. A full closet with regular hangers and a safe, a 32" flat screen TV and an I-POD station were nice extras. There is an honor bar w/o key that we stayed away from. Two double size beds were terrifically supportive(ie-firm)with a nice pillowtop to give it a cushy feeling. The room was done in shades of off-white with touches of gold, and color supplied by 3 modern prints on the wall. A modern, clean look! The bathroom is on the small side, but contains a freestanding counter with towels on bottom shelves, again emphasizing modernity. Fixtures are nice but not grand, and I did not care for the low toilet seat. Color came from inlaid small tile octangles above counter and in shower. Portico toiletries thrilled me, not my wife or son. Two of the four glass enclosed elevators were up and running. Since they rise thru a 3 story atrium(set above entry floor) to outside the hotel with views towards the harbor, and they are beautifully lit a night, they are part of the fun. The atrium restaurant was nicely turned out-the breakfast buffet good but not spectactular. They are still re-doing restrooms on the 1st floor of the atrium(2 cnd fl) where there is a business center, gift shop and coffee bar. What really surprised us was the friendliness of the staff thru-out the hotel and the prompt service we got when we had special requests. In recent years, I have not experienced such a personable staff at other Hyatts. Parking is 27 for self park, 35 for valet but you must pay for parking in the inner harbor so this is not outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location..no problem..Great food..no problem...Relaxation.WHAT A PROBLEM!!”
Reviews.Author: schvamla
Reviews.Content: Stayed for new years eve and had a nice view of the fireworks. Cudos to Baltimore on that show. My wife and I were wanting a safe vantage point of the show away from the drunk drivers and it seemed we would have been better off out with the crowds, because we think all the drunks were in the hotel! Very thin walls which made hearing vomiting from the neighbors above us easy. Not to mention all the hallway noises. Given, it was New Years, but give me a break, it was as they were in the same room!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: CarpeDiem45
Reviews.Content: As a getaway after Christmas for a day and a smal adventure, my wife and I chose Baltimore. Baltimore is a fun American city that doesn't seem to get the PR it deserves. (As opposed to Washington, DC which dominates the area.) The Hyatt was very conveniently located on the Inner Harbor, near the "Little Italy" area and all the shops. The Science center, National Aquarium , a submarine,and the USS Constitution are right outside our door. So much to do. Just down the road, see Fort McHenry where Francis Scott Key wrote the Star Spangle Banner. It was the day before a Ravens games so apparently we had the football team and staff overnight there as well. Lots of oposing team fans too. Nonetheless, there was no noise or other distractions from what must be a "big deal" for kids. The hotel is being refurbished a bit so parts are blocked off but that didn't impact us. The hotel's scale doesn't measure up to a Grand Hyatt but we knew that when we planned our trip so we were not disappointed. Customer Service staff was excellent! Amazing might be a better work. Estella and Joe took such good care of us that my wife wants to go back just to chat with them...so helpful and knowledgeable. We went out to dinner at Da Mimmo and the staff arranged a limo to pick up up at the hotel. Room clean and well configured. Everything worked.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: JTinCO
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in July and it was acceptable. No problems at all. In fact, they upgraded us to a room on the seventh floor (721 if I recall correctly) that was great. It was on a corner of the hotel and offered just about a 180 degree view of the harbor! Definitely try to ask for this room. It's at the end of the hallway but the view is worth it. See atached pictures. Room was clean and the staff in the lobby was friendly. We needed a cab for dinner in Little Italy. A staff member hailed one for us in a snap. No problems at all. Great location to the Inner Harbor. Walk right over the walkway and you're there. I'd come back if ever in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not great”
Reviews.Author: strizis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights while on vacation. It was a beautiful hotel, and nicely located and had a nice view of the Inner harbor area, but the room, and the beds were nothing special. We got free breakfast and that too wasn't special, but one day I ordered off the menu, and it was delecious. Parking was a lot, but I knew that ahead of time.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service, Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: ala737
Reviews.Content: My husband I booked a room directly with the hotel from an event room block, two months in advance. On arrival, we were told that the hotel was sold out and the only accomodation they could offer us was the living room of a suite -- no, not a whole suite, just the LIVING ROOM PORTION, meaning we had to sleep on a sofabed! The desk agent gave us 50% off the rate and free breakfast, but no one gave an apology or explanation and damn, was that sofabed uncomfortable. On top of all that, the sofabed wasn't even made up properly, the shower curtain rod was loose so that the curtain couldn't be pulled all the way across, and the TV didn't work properly.

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off, Not A Place To Hold A Conference”
Reviews.Author: PROF_CONSULTANT
Reviews.Content: I went to a conference there in March and luckily only stayed a night. The room was average and nothing special for the money. The biggest rip-off is the Overnight Parking. I can see paying $36 a night in NY or even Chicago, but Baltimore???? If I was to stay two nights - I would have been better off taking a taxi from the airport - even though it is a far drive - than renting a car and paying for parking. You would think they would have a reduced rate for a guest - but they don't. $36 a night for parking? I even wrote that on their survey which they conveniently leave out any question about the cost of parking. The manager sending out the survey never responded. So how concerned are they about your stay? This was my first time in Baltimore and I would not think about going there again. As for holding a conference there, pick another city. Las Vegas, Chicago, Dallas/ Fort Worth (Hyatt accessible by monorail from airport).

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: AWS_NC
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hyatt while attending a conference in Baltimore. The hotel is in a great location, especially if you're traveling alone; it's connected via skywalk to Harborplace... lots of shops and restaurants. The hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. I would recommend this hotel to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend it”
Reviews.Author: ModerateTraveler
Reviews.Content: I was only at the hotel one night, but was really happy with my experience. The room was enormous with really nice features, including a large remodeled bathroom and a bench seat along the window. The bed was comfortable. The location was great, just a walk across the footbridge from the inner harbor. The staff was incredible efficient, with prompt answers to my questions, always ready to direct me to where I needed to go, etc. I also really liked the TV checkout feature and, sure enough, my receipt was waiting for me when I got downstairs 5 minutes later. I've stayed at a number of more 'elite' hotels recently on business, and found this one to be my best experience. I didn't give it a '5' rating only because I didn't have experience with other features of the hotel, like the restaurant, room service, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DMacey
Reviews.Content: So I just got back fom a short weekend in Baltimore for a Family get together. We have been staying at the Hyatt for almost a decade and the recent $20 million renovation was really nice. The location is perfect with a walkway to the inner harbor area and walking distance to Camden Yards. The rooms were clean and comfortable with a new modern design and amenities (HDTV, Coffee Maker, Iron, Hair Dryer, etc.). Outside of that however the hotel is not a place for couples or families as it mainly caters to Conventions, there were two while we were there and they dominate the hotel. A sales convention had drunk salesmen keeping us up at night and a cheerleader convention had us awake with screaming girls in the moring. In addition service was really sub par. Long lines at check in (only two desk attendants and a broken automated machine for over 20 people!), room service forgot to pick up our breakfast order, and they didn't place the newspaper next to our door, they threw it at it and woke us up at 5:30am. So in summary this is a great place to have a convention and is in the heart of all the tourists attractions, but for a romantic getaway or quiet weekend it is not the place!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location but some issues”
Reviews.Author: grhokie
Reviews.Content: My wife, two kids and I stayed at the Hyatt in mid-April. It is a great location. We parked the car and never saw it again until check out. The hotel is literally across the street from the Inner Harbor. We walked to the National Aquarium (awesome), the Maryland Science Center (also awesome) and even up to Oriole Park (3 or so blocks) and the Babe Ruth Birthplace Museum (another 2-3 blocks past Oriole Park). We walked to the Harbor malls for lunch and dinner. Best location there is. The rooms were nice but the doors and walls were incredibly thin. The Hyatt had some sort of teenage event on Saturday night and the teenagers congregated in the halls. When they weren't yelling and laughing (which was most of the time) even normal conversations in the hall sounded loud and as if in our room. Security (I called them twice) just disbursed them temporarily and it was clear the hotel took no other action besides asking them to quiet down because as soon as security left our floor, they would start all over again. I eventually became my father and went out and used the "you kids quiet down" line. That worked better than security in keeping them in the rooms. At check-out, the front desk staff's response to this same story: "Oh, yeah, we had a lot of complaints." Valet parking was very fast and friendly but incredibly expensive and, as it turned out (see above), totally unnecessary. The restaurants in the hotel were also incredibly expensive so we ate elsewhere. The outdoor pool, tennis courts and basketball court sat on the roof of the 6th floor. We thought this would be very cool but all were very run down. The fitness center, however, was about the best I have seen in a hotel. It had a lot of cardio equipment, good weight machines and even a full rack of dumbbells! One last note: the conceirge recommended a restaurant for dinner in Little Italy, Rocco's. They picked us up at the hotel and even drove us back! The food was great and the service even better! My kids were the only kids in the place and we were still treated very well and they were doted on by waitstaff from other tables.

Reviews.Title: “get crabby at the hyatt”
Reviews.Author: safarimikelauri
Reviews.Content: There seems to have been a recent renovation, but they overlook basic housekeeping. I was less impressed with the rainforest brown granite night stands, than the hair all over the bathroom floor when we arrived. There was a cigarette burn in the bedspread, although the room was a nonsmoking room, so I really don't know where the bedspread came from. There were no wood suit hangers in the closet when we arrived and it took 4 requests to get them. 3 phone calls brought 2 different stafrf members carrying wire hangers, and these were badly bent wire hangers. When we called the manager for assistance, she debated us about thi for 5 minutes until we actually hung up on her, a first for us. After we hung up 4 wood suit hangers appeared...It's just not worth it to stay here. Meanwhile there were a couple of bright notes: The pillows really were fluffy and the crabcakes at a private party in the upstairs restaurant were excellent. I have to say I would think twice before staying at any Hyatt after the issues we had here. My suggestion: skip the hotel, and go for the crab cakes.

Reviews.Title: “a bit too warm”
Reviews.Author: avillebud
Reviews.Content: I recently spent seven nights at the Hyatt in Baltimore on business. I arrived at 2:15 in the morning as my flight had been delayed. Lets just say the graveyard front desk staff is there at that hour for a reason. She was not horrible, but she was not friendly, had her shoes off and was chewing gum. There was NO smile on her face the entire time. As for the room... it was nice but the room was warm. The temperature shows that it goes down to 60... it does not. It only goes to 70. I had someone come to my room... and he tried everything he could to get it to work properly... but I am sure the Hyatt has them set not to go below 70 to save money. They want you to think you can set it at 60 but the room will be 70 degrees. The room was also VERY dry. Take some chap stick and lotion! As on the positive side, the rooms were nice. The shower was great. The bed was comfortable. The gym, is one of the best gyms at a hotel that is a chain and not a luxury hotel. It was very close to the convention center. I might stay here again... if the temperature in my room could have been cooler and not so dry I would have enjoyed the hotel... I was just a bit too warm and super dry the entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay here!”
Reviews.Author: shedeez
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights for a busness trip (3/4-3/6). I took a taxi here from BWI. Once I arrived, the bell hop opened my door and removed my luggage out of the taxi and brought it to the front desk as I was paying - I was truly impressed. The lobby was beautiful and clean. The front desk staff was friendly and quick. The view from the elevator was amazing even though it was evening by the time I got to the hotel. My room had all the modern furniture/amenities - LCD TV, king size bed, comfy bed/sofa, tile shower, pedestal sink, etc. I had a view of the harbour. Every morning the sun would rise on the side I was at so it was pleasure seeing this every morning. I used the internet in the room and it was easy to log in. You must use t-mobile but the directions were easy to set up an account. The TV was great - it had many channels and the images/graphics were clear. The next morning I wanted to grab something quick for breakfast, so I went to the 2nd floor and stop by Perks to get a croissant and water. It wasn't the best croissant I had but it had a crunchy/flasky crust and sof t on the inside. It was actually pretty good. This was great place to stay and would definitely come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a short business stay”
Reviews.Author: biztraveler31
Reviews.Content: Only had a one night stay for business. Overall the hotel was good, but nothing spectacular or memorable (good or bad.) Staff interactions were mostly positive and the rooftop restaurant, Pices, is quite good if you like seafood. Would I pay a lot of money to stay here on my own? Doubtful.

Reviews.Title: “Well pleased...”
Reviews.Author: Redbud
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel overnight for a recent business meeting. Front desk personnel were pleasant and efficient. Concierge was very helpful in trying to find a restaurant for me, but it was raining and late so I opted for room service (french onion soup which was very tasty, and a Cobb salad, which was not as good). My room 541, was at the end of the hall and uniquely shaped. Because it was on a corner it had a long hallway in the room to get to the sleeping area. Bed was very comfortable, shower was large enough for two people comfortably and was an pleasing marble with blue accent tile line. Only bad thing was the handle on the door to the shower was too small to grasp from the inside, and the way the shower is designed you can't turn on the water without being partially IN the shower and so COLD water hits you before you can turn the knob to warm. The room is unique not only is it's shape but in that three of the four walls of the room are all glass floor to ceiling! Since the hotel is nicely located near the water and harbor area the view was engaging and almost surround although there were some office buildings on one side of the view. I totally enjoyed the glass walls, but it did make it so I had to turn up the heat at night, and I did hear street noise in the morning. The elevator was shaped like an arrow and all glass as well. The a/c system was apparently piping out some freshly scented freshner because it was the first thing I noticed getting off the elevator. Wish I could replicate that at home! Their fine dining restaurant was closed oddly enough (it was only 8pm) so I can't comment on it. All in all I would definitely stay here again and recommend it. I have pix on on my cell phone and when I slow down traveling I'll try to post them.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not what I expected from the Hyatt Regency”
Reviews.Author: SunnySarahAM428
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a brief weekend getaway for the New Year's holiday. We live in Harford County, MD, so we're only about 20-30 min from Baltimore's Inner Harbor - we've taken many day trips there and have always enjoyed all the Harbor has to offer. This was one of the only overnighters we've had there recently, and we specfically booked a room at the Hyatt because of its reputation - I have to say, I was somewhat disappointed with certain aspects of the hotel. Check-in was quick and simple - we provided the front desk with our confirmation number, I.D. and a credit card and were assigned a room on the spot. (We checked-in on 12/30 for two nights, as we had dinner reservations at Flemings the first evening - which we HIGHLY recommend! Awesome service, food, etc etc!) The room was described to us as a "Queen room with a Harbor view". We were in #702 - a small, triangular, oddly laid out space. The amenities in the room itself were fabulous - a huge, beautifully tiled showed (big enough for two) and a modern looking vanity unit in the bathroom; marble-topped furniture and the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in (although my boyfriend and I both agreed - it was NOT a full queen size, as we have a queen sized bed in our own home) with down pillows and a down comforter. But the room itself was a weird shape, and the furniture felt packed-in - straight ahead after walking in was a large desk, to the right was the mini-bar (which you couldn't open all the way, as the door would hit the desk leg), to the left was the bed, set an an angle with about two feet of room from the foot of the bed to the dresser (the TV was on top of the dresser). The flat screen TV was grainy (lacking HD) and automatically reset itself to an "OnCommand" menu every time it was shut off - after attempting to use a "Free 5 minute preview" of the TV's music service, without pushing anything we ended up ordering it for $9.99 for only two hours! (Note: When we called the front desk to ask about the music service, the girl replied "Um I think it's for 24 hours but I really don't know" - way to educate the staff...)(Somehow our bill was charged 4 times for the music service...refer to my check-out comments). Movies were grossly overpriced at at least $10.99 a piece, although if you were looking to see something that wasn't available on DVD yet, you could most likely find it here. Basically, if you're electronically inept (which the hotel is obviously hoping for), you'll end up spending a whole heap of money just off the TV. Oh yes, and the lovely little remote stopped working halfway through our stay. We had an entire wall of large windows that more or less looked out over the hotel itself and at the windows on the other side (if you look at how the hotel is "V"-shaped, you'll see what I mean), but we did have an angular view of the harbor and the adjoining mall. The room had its own digital thermostat, which was great but set up a bit oddly - if you turned the temp up, the heat triggered on, but if you tried to just turn the head down, the A/C clicked on. We did sleep in a bit on New Year's Eve, and did not leave the room until around 2:00PM. The maids were servicing other rooms on our floor, so we removed our "Privacy Please" sign and left the hotel. We arrived later that evening only to find our room as we had left it - disheveled bed, dirty towels and all. I called the front desk to request new towels - when the maid came to the door, she only handed me two large towels, though I had asked for a full set. When I asked if she had any small towels, she said "I doubt it" and brought me back one of each smaller size. How does a hotel that large not have an abundance of clean towels on hand?? I also ended up with a monster of a blister from some heels that had not been broken in yet - when I called the front desk to ask for a band-aid, I was a bit surprised to find that you had to purchase them from the Gift Shop, which was already closed. (The next day I bought an 8-pack of crappy travel band-aids for $1.99.) On New Year's Eve, my boyfriend and I attempted to get into Bistro 300, the smaller of the two restaurants at the hotel (Picsces, the large bar at the top of the hotel, had a special New Year's celebration and only a limited number of guests who paid in advance were allowed in). The host told us they were full for approximately another hour (at 10:30PM) but that he would call our room as soon as there was an opening. By 11:45PM there was no phone call, so we went back downstairs only to find that they had closed for the evening. For lack of better words, we were pissed. We spent midnight out on one of the bridges that connects the hotel to the adjoining mall so we could watch the fireworks - it was nice, although we were bombarded with an entire wedding party (but hey, it was a wedding and a holiday, we weren't mad). Check-out was hectic, since it was New Year's Day. They have self check-in/out kiosks, which we used for check-out, but upon seeing extra charges on our bill we had to stand in line to speak to the front desk. Additional charges to the bill totaled over $100.00, to include parking, which was overpriced at $27.00/day, but we knew about that ahead of time; four TV music orders which we did not place; a 12 oz can of cranapple we took from the mini-bar which was $3.50 (an employee of the hotel told us all soda vending machines were removed after the mini-bars were put in each room)....needless to say, my boyfriend disputed the TV music charges. The woman at the front desk just clicked away on her computer without saying a word, handed us a new receipt minus the charges and yelled "Next!" Overall, our experience here was not the top-notch one we had expected. The staff was not very friendly or experienced, or even knowledgable at that. The room was nice, but for what we paid we expected something much larger. The location was great - we spent most of the day Sunday at Hooters watching the Ravens game (tip: if you're a woman and have never been to Hooters, give it a try - the food is awesome and the waitresses are absolutely adorable!) and were able to grab a cab for $5 to Flemings. Next time, we'll probably stay at the Waterfront Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: msanders-TRIP
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt on New Years Eve. What a disappointmet! I'll make this short & sweet. First let me say the total room cost was $358.00 for the night - not cheap by any means. Our room wasn't ready until 6pm - meanwhile we sat at the Bistro 300 drinking warm $6.00 Corona's. When we asked about ordering some food we were told we couldn't because they were preparing for the NYE buffet and "were afraid they would run out of stuff if the people at the bar started ordering food". But, the website says: Bistro 300 Located on the third level, Bistro 300 is the perfect place to meet friends or watch the game. Drink and appetizer specials are available during baseball and football season. Over-the-bar TV's and three new Plasma TV's are available to watch your favorite sports while relaxing in our cigar-friendly lounge. Hours: Daily: 6:30 am - 10:00 pm Finally got into our room, it wasn't very clean. There were still Cheeto's laying around on the floor from the previous occupants. What's worse is I'm convinced the shower has not had a good cleaning in awhile. The grout not only had black mildew, but a pink film on the floor. Remember, this room was $358. Since it was rainy out and we haven't eaten since morning, we thought we would go to the Pisces Lounge get something to eat (finally)and watch the fireworks, afterall here's what they have to say on their website: Pisces Lounge Enjoy your favorite beverage while taking in Baltimore's Best View of the Inner Harbor. Choose from a selection of specialty martinis and enjoy a seafood sampling from our fresh raw bar. Light fare menu is also available. Well, it was closed for a privet event. Now I know why the mini bar Cheeto's were such a hit. We didn't get anything to eat and fell asleep around 11:30. I wasn't in the mood for fireworks at this point. Remember, the room cost $358!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location! Very nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: Missshopper
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect for the activities at the Inner Harbor and close to the sports facilities. We booked this for an overnight getaway and were lucky to have beautiful, mild weather this time of the year. We took a package which included a harborview room, aquarium tickets, and self parking for $261. After doing this, I called back and said I thought I would just book the room itself as I wasn't sure we would have enough time for the aquarium. Luckily, I was advised to keep the package as the room rate without anything was $499. The room certainly wouldn not have been worth that! It was a nice room but nothing out of the ordinary except a big window seat that was nice to watch the harbor area. I did not book Regency Club as I felt we could not take advantage of the lounge as we would be out most of the time. We checked in before noon and had advised the hotel we would be doing so. The first receptionist was not the least bit helpful and told me to check back in a couple of hours to see if our room was ready. A few minutes later, I went to ask anothe receptionist a question and she immediately gave us a room with everything we had requested. We only ate breakfast at the hotel which was okay. We were the only two in the dining room and the service was still slow. There was not a big selection. Downstairs there was supposed to be a coffee cart with donuts and pastries but it never opened. The shops around the area were just typical tourist shops withe some of the routine chain shops at a small mall (Talbots, Banana Republic, Bebe). There is a nice selection of restaurants in the area. We had dinner at Ruth Chris Steakhouse which was okay. They do have a car that will pick you up and take you back. This branch, on Water Street, was very nice inside. We expected more from the food. My steak had grizzle and fat - my husbands was thin and shriveled. Truthfully, I have had just as good steaks at less expensive chain restaurants. There was also no nice presentation of anything on the platters- just a steak on a dish - that's it!!! We did go to the aquarium which was small but nice as well as the Imax Theater. the Science Center is only geared for children as a hands on experience and we were just killing time there before the Imax movie.

Reviews.Title: “Recently renovated and we're Raven about it!”
Reviews.Author: tpapi
Reviews.Content: Pardon our corny title, but we recently returned from a one-night stay at the Hyatt Regency Baltimore for my wife's birthday after securing a Priceline rate of $125. At the time of our booking on 11/9 Hyatt was listing the room at $309 per night. By using Priceline we saved nearly $200. Having never seen this hotel listed under $275 per night, we were pleasantly surprised. We would strongly suggest using alternative internet sites and save. We enjoyed the Hyatt but it would have been highway robbery to pay that kind of exorbitant money to stay at the Inner Harbor. While it's nice to be next to the water it's not like you can swim or sunbathe there. It's a fun area but the hotels are price gouging if they think $300 is a fair price. As you can see by our review you can stay here for much less. Unless attending a coference, you'll probably spend most of your time outside the hotel as the Light and Pratt Street Pavillions, Maryland Science Center, Federal Hill, and National Aquarium are directly across the street and well within walking distance. Ther'es more than enough to keep you occupied. One of the downsides is that you have a large number of homeless people who congregate outside of all the properties and at the harbor area venues. While they seemed harmless enough you do need to keep your wits about you. As far as the hotel is concerned, Hyatt has recently upgraded the atrium and hallways giving it a bright and modern appearance. The guestrooms, which have also been remodeled, come complete with flatscreen plasma TV's in the bedroom and scald-proof showers in the bathroom. This can be a bummer if you like taking a really hot bath or shower as the water temperature doesn't get very hot. However, it's a nice safety feature. Our overall opinion of the room was that it was clean, spacious, and gives you a great view of the city if you request a harbor view. The staff, including the concierge, front desk, and bellmen were all very friendly and accessible. They took the time to answer questions and seemed interested in us having a good stay. This has always been the case in our previos trips to Maryland. The hotel restaurant, Bistro 300, was a good place to eat for breakfast at nearly 16 per person for an all you can eat buffet. Our 18-month old was allowed to eat for free. The food was fresh and above average with the staff being extremely conversational and nice. This has always been the case in our previous trips to Maryland. We would definitely stay there again if we found another great rate but would pass if forced to pay anything close to what's listed on the Hyatt website.

Reviews.Title: “A Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: Historiana
Reviews.Content: Hotel has an excellent location - very convenient to the Inner Harbor, Convention Center, Aquarium, Camden Yards. Common areas of the hotel are very convenient and nice. Room was very spacious although showed a little wear and tear. Staff was very friendly. Only warning was that we booked a non-smoking room at a discounted rated. The fine print said that our preferences could not be guaranteed and sure enough we did not get a non-smoking room - so be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business meeting”
Reviews.Author: hnewburn
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay here, but had a business meeting with several customers over 4 days. The staff was just fantastic. Everyone went out of their way to be friendly, they accomodated changes on the fly, the concierge hooked us up with a great place for dinner on short notice and in general everyone had a great time. The catered food was interesting and tasty, even the to-go sandwiches they packed was good. Only ding was on Bistro 300 restaurant, the food was just OK, usual hotel overpricing, and the service was bad. Drinks at the bar was fine, but skip dinner there.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Poor Staff”
Reviews.Author: Gordon31
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt arriving the day before Labour Day for business from the UK. We were allocated rooms on the 4th floor which overlooked the gallery. We expected noise on the Sunday night, it was after all a holiday but at 3am the floor polisher went on until 5am was a bit much. The monday the hotel was empty, no buffet breakfats only over priced menu. That night the polisher started at 3.30am. A call to reception went ignored. The Tuesday night drunken conventioneers echoed the atrium until 2am then the polisher came on at 3. Surly reception staff who had difficuty splitting a booking and dealing with non US visitors. Then to make matters worse - $96 for internet access and $30 + to park the hire care. Great location, but overpriced and not a Hyatt as I know them

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt is Yankee Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Yankeefan26
Reviews.Content: We stayed here September 9th for one night (came in for a Yankee game). I can't really comment on the price since I got a corporate rate and only paid $175 for the one night (but I think the rooms ranged from $399 to $444 which is alot for just one night in my opnion.) The hotel is in a great location- 2-3 blocks to Camden Yards + there is a walkway that takes you right to the Inner Harbor area with all the shops & restaurants. The employees in the hotel were very friendly, always said hello, have a nice stay do you need any help or information (even the parking garage attendants). My husband forgot to pack toothpaste so we went to the gift shop & they had a tiny tube for $5 (which I couldnt see spending really). I asked an employee that was in there if the hotel provided that to the guests and she said yes.. do you need a toothbrush & razor also? The room was very nice, flat screen TV, comfortable beds, good size bathrooms. There weren't any washcloths though.. I thought that was strange. I made a reservation for Pisces Restaurant for dinner after the game, but decided on Mortens Steakhouse in the Sheraton instead (Pisces had a very limited menu). We did have breakfast at the Bistro, $17.95 buffet for breakfast- kind of steep I think for what they offered, but we ate there anyway. (Don't eat at Phillips buffet for dinner- not enough choices unless you like everything fried). The only complaint I had was the elevators, or lack there of I should say.. I think out of 5 of them, only 2 were working. There was a sign that said they were renovating some of them and they would be finished in 2007. So you had to wait a long time for one. You could use the stairs, but we were on the 7th floor. I would definenately stay there again if I got the corporate rate= I don't think I would spend $400. You can stay 15 mins out of the Inner Harbor for much less and drive in- The Renaissance only charges $10 a day to park.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt scores with upgrades”
Reviews.Author: nzrocks
Reviews.Content: Hyatt has just finished an upgrade with this hotel and they hit all the right notes. The rooms are terrific, though the walls still seem to let in too much noise. We stayed this weekend on the Regency Club floor and I have not had such a good experience with club levels since I was in Australia and New Zealand. They do the club level right and I was very impressed. The rooms are great, the staff is fine, and the location is perfect. This is a fine place to stay in Baltimore, and you'll enjoy the club level here.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency great for Yankee Fans!”
Reviews.Author: adyanks
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Regency August 5th through the 8th 2006. Coming from New York, we wanted to be near Camden Yards and the Inner Harbor and this hotel is in the heart of both! The Skywalk from the hotel's lobby leaves you steps from the inner Harbor which is filled with excellent food, shopping and entertainment. We booked the package wherein you get two aquarium tickets so we went with the kids. We walked a few blocks to see our beloved Yankees play two games and then strolled back to the hotel. The Hyatt is very clean and efficient. The staff was helpful. The room was spacious and we had a very nice view. We did not experience a lot of noise as some reviewers have stated. The only downside were the elevators. We had to wait several times because they were full. Not a big deal if you are on a lower floor but we were not. Anyway, we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but could be better...”
Reviews.Author: siskiyous
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a three night stay at the Hyatt Regency for a conference. The newly remodeled room was lovely and the location of the hotel is perfect. That said, there were a number of areas where the hotel could make improvements. I had long waits both on check-in and check-out -- each time only one attendent was at the front desk and it was very frustrating. I was late getting to the airport upon checkout because of the long wait. Also, I went to the Business Center to check my email and found that I would have to pay $10 just to use a computer! I have never had to do that at any other hotel before. And, for some reason a small percentage of guests had newspapers outside their doors in the morning but the rest of us did not. The walls are very thin and I kept hearing slamming doors (I think because of their weight). I would still give this hotel a high rating because it is beautiful and in such a lovely location. We also enjoyed the restaurant, Pisces, though it was very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Timmy485
Reviews.Content: I was surprised at a Hyatt getting all the bad reviews this one has so I had my expectations low when we set out for Baltimore. We arrived in Baltimore and found the parking garage to self park. The garage is a fairly dangerous place to negotiate. There is a large fence in the middle of it and at one point there is only one lane for cars going in and going out. We got parked and headed into the hotel. Had a bit of a wait but I think it was from some people that were being difficult with the staff. Now we had a regency club room but the club room was not done being renovated so they offered to take the extra charge off the bill, upgrade us to a harbor view room or give us vouchers for drinks and appetizers in the lounge on the 3rd floor. We took the vouchers and they worked out well. The room we had over looked the pool and part of the harbor. It was fairly nice view. The room was spacious with a very comfy bed. The bathroom was just as nice with a great tiled shower. I can only think of two bad things about the room. They had a nice flat screen tv in the room but you could only get maybe five channels which seemed like a waste of a good tv not to mention little viewing options. The second negative comment was the noise in the hallway. I think the door actually amplified the noise in the hallway rather than block some of it out. Other than those two things the rooms were great. The elavators in the hotel seemed to be hit or miss. Sometimes we got right on, other times you had a good wait ahead of you. The best thing about this hotel is the location. Walk across the street and you on the Harbor. A few steps up the harbor and you are at the water taxi stop to Fell's Point which I think is ten times better than the Inner Harbor. All in all this hotel is worth the money just for the location.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dee2673
Reviews.Content: I don't where everyone else stayed but the place I stayed..the Hyatt in Baltimore..was really nice! No trouble or excessive wait for the elevator..We had a harbor view room that was beautiful..Awesome bathroom...REALLY cool workout room! When we checked in ,there was no toilet paper in the bathroom..so we used tissues til the next day, when the maid came..To me ,anyway, no big deal Self park was..well, self park. There was an elevator in the garage and not being big babies, we didn't mind schleping our stuff out there..It was actually pretty easy. We ate the the fancy restaurant on the hotel..and it was lovely..Yeah, it was expensive but the view was worth it We EXPECTED it to be expensive. After all, you don't stay at a Hyatt and think you're going to have a budget meal! NO noise..no construction stuff..but it was a weekend, so maybe the guys don't work on the weekends. We had no complaints so I don't know about the service issues others seem to have had. While no one was extremely friendly, neither were they rude We travel a great deal ,both budget and nicer hotels. I would definitely return to this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Not 100% luxury but not the worst of the lot either”
Reviews.Author: bluevt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days. This place touts itself as a luxury hotel and while the bedding was nice (down comforters reminded me of home) and the bed was quite comfortable, luxury does not just mean nice products, bedding, and Flat screen tvs. This hotel could learn a thing or 2 about service... Upon making a reservation, I specifically requested a non smoking room and when we checked in, confirmed that we would be getting a non smoking king room. However, their idea of non smoking room was a Febrezed to death smoking room. Then they put us in an actual non smoking room (but double) but the A/C didn't work . The third time was a charm and finally put us in a non smoking room that A/C and was a suite. Why do hotels insist on assigning guests who ask for non smoking rooms to smoking rooms? Cons: paper thin walls extremely slow elevator front desk slow to pick up phone Pros: really nice bathroom the room was very clean very comfortable bed good location food wasn't bad for a hotel (though the roomservice coffee was an utter joke) I wouldn't recommend this for business travelers as it was very noisy and there were some service issues. But lots of families were there and seemed to be enjoying themselves. Note that the pool is tiny. But they do have tennis courts and a new gym. Had we paid the standard rate I would have felt completely ripped off. But for what we paid, it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: metsisme
Reviews.Content: First, I'll mention that this hotel is under a massive renovation project that seems to have upset a few people back in June. It is still under renovation in July, althouth many of the problems that were mentioned in June reviews have been addressed and/or fixed. I had a King/Non-smoking room on the 12th floor (Regency Club Level, although the Regency Club Bar is under construction and not open). Unfortunatly I didn't have a harbor view, but the view of the downtown skyline was also nice. Customer Service was very good. I was not issued a parking pass when I arrived and had to go get one at the desk a day later, and the front desk was very appologetic for the oversight. Room was great...very large, modern furniture and fixtures. I had a great King sized bed with tons of pillows, two small lounge chairs, a desk and a rolling desk chair. 37" Flat Screen HD TV was also nice and swiveled 360 degrees so I could see it great from the bed and from the desk. The bathroom was nicely appointed with chrome and glass fixtures and glass shower with granite countertops and good tile (no tub - this might concern some travelers with children or seniors). AC in the hallways and common areas of the hotel was very cool...nice to walk in from the summer heat and humidity and into cool, beautiful lobby. Overall service was excellent, but with three dozen bars and restaraunts in walking distance, I never ate at the hotel. From glancing at the menu, prices at the casual dining restaraunt (bistro 300) are overpriced and the upscale, top floor restaraunt (Picese) was VERY overprices...but this is nothing unusual for a downtown, upscale hotel. Hey, the parking garadge has a sky-bridge walkway to Hooters on the Waterfront, why the heck are you eating at the hotel! Drinks at the Bistro 300 were high as well...16 bucks for a Sapphire and Tonic and glass of house red. Again, a dozen bars across the street at the harbor waterfront...go there and drink for half the price. There was some construction going on in the parking garadge. Loud outside but not in the hotel itself. Did have some noise in the hallway penetrating my room from time to time, but the hotel cant be accountable for every 2:00 AM door slam. Minor Issues: 1. 9.99/day wireless internet. 2. 18/day self parking...these things combined add almost 30 dollars to your daily bill. 3. Slow elevators. Expect up to a 5 minute wait in the AM if the hotel is full. Not as bad at night. Overall, a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “just barely ok - pretty disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Okemosian
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights at the Hyatt while attending a conference. I'll start with the few positives: Our king room - 610 - overlooked the harbor, which was nice. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room decor pleasant. The location, connected to the convention center by an open air skywalk, was pretty good. And now the negatives: - Two days in a row I did not receive the wake-up calls I requested and so missed morning mtgs. - After having left a $4 tip for housekeeping, we returned to find the bathroom wastebasket sitting in the middle of the foyer, and no coffee or cups - general cleaning was clearly hasty and careless - We never knew what we would get in terms of towels - one day we had no washcloths, another day, no bathmat, and I had to call to get a room service breakfast menu for the door - There were bloodstains on the sheets (like another reviewer, I say "weird!") - The elevators were very slow and one of them was under repair our entire stay - There was constant hammering and drilling going on - One morning we received a letter under our door informing us that the water would be shut off from 12-5 - Bistro 300 was mediocre and overpriced. The Pisces brunch ($40 a head) was waaaaay overpriced. - Air-conditioning in the entire hotel was barely working - very hot in the hallways especially And, as another reviewer noted, when we checked out no one asked if we enjoyed our stay or if everything went well. I don't know what's going on with the Hyatt chain, but we also had a bad stay at the upscale Hyatt in Toronto. Terrible service, indifference by management to numerous screw-ups. I'd definitely choose another hotel if/when I return to Baltimore. Not worth $219 a night, and that was the "lower" conference rate. It's a shame - I remember when Hyatts were reliably excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre At Best”
Reviews.Author: LittleDeuceCoupe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Regency Baltimore for one night on 6/03/06 and am happy it wasn't longer. We drove to town for the Yankees/Orioles game and booked the Hyatt for an overpriced nightly rate of $400 because when we made the reservation a month ago, the more popular hotels had no vacancies. With the understanding that the Hyatt was in the midst of its $16 million renovation, we were not expecting a great deal. We were told by the hotel reservationist that our harbor view room on the 7th floor was newly renovated, and the weekend construction should be minimal. In a nut shell, with the exception of the Hyatt's being withing walking distance of the ball park and the lovely harbor view, our renovated room was a non-descript average sized rectangular box with paper thin walls and a front door that permitted every door slam, cough, and hall conversation to disturb us thoughout the night. At 12:15 AM, we were awakened by someone knocking at the room next door. It was Housekeeping trying unsuccessfully to deliver the roll away bed that we had requested at the front desk when we checked in at 3:00 PM! The new double beds were too small although comfortable and would have been a significant improvement to the room had they been queen sized. The flat screened TV was a nice touch, but the bathroom was disappointing with its small sink, unfashionable chrome fixtures, poor lighting, and a disgustingly filthy old bath tub that had hair in three places. The guest services checkout function on the TV didn't work, the two working elevators were small, had no air conditioning, and the only way we could catch one going down after a 10 minute wait was to get in one going up. Even with the renovations about to be completed, we would NOT return to the Hyatt in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Love the guest rooms and staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to the Hyatt for my birthday and what an experince. The renovation is almost over and the rooms are fab!!!!!! We walked to the ballpark after trying the seafood buffet which was great. We are going back for the 4th of JULY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Hyatt Inner Harbor was horrible and the frustration was only equaled by the $349 per nite rate plus the additional $19 for parking in a construction zone. The Hyatt indicated that they were going thru a $16 Million Dollar rennovation. This is at the expense of current customer satisfaction. Jack-hammer noise everywhere, dust, dirt, detours...everywhere. The experience did not end there, we had to initiate action to get toilet products replaced, no complimentary newspaper (...at almost $400 per nite...please). Elevators were continuosly under repair, houskeeping was marginal, and the staff was...O.K. at best. When we checked out...no one even asked how we enjoyed our stay? Not what one wants to experience for a three day $1,000 dollar experience. I could go on...but, I think that I made my point.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience Ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I only stayed two nights, Sunday Monday, but the two nights were not the best. I arrived late Sunday evening, and was NOT told there was a $14 million renovation being done to the hotel upon check-in. The first morning I went to work so didn't notice the construction noise. The second day I got sick and just needed to rest, but the noise was SO loud, it sounded like someone was jack-hammering in my room. I had a migraine and it was the worst noise ever! I called the front desk who advised me everyone was told about construction when making reservation and upon check-in. Well since my resvervation was done online by my travel agent, no notice was given and agent didn't tell me upon check-in. Finally after getting up, packed and dressed it was 11:00a. The mgr moved me to a room on the 14th floor where the noise was minimal and could be tuned out w/ earplugs. I was able to get a late check-out at 3:00p. In my opionion, they should have comped something off the price of the room. I also was displeased to know the restaurant on the top floor of the hotel was closed on Sun and Mon. I found the front-desk clerks not very helpful or nice. Not service I would expect at $199/night per person. I would never saty there again. There are too many other hotels to have to put up with this.

Reviews.Title: “Eh...it was OK”
Reviews.Author: HoopyKat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Inner Harbor for a conference. I was getting into Baltimore very late, so I called the hotel to inform them. They assured me they would hold my room for me, which they did. Check in was a breeze...very friendly and helpful. Parking is $19 a day self park, $25 a day valet. There is a major renovation going on at the hotel, and a majority of the parking spaces were unavailable due to construction. The first three levels of the garage are reserved for valet and the Budget rental franchise. There is an elevator that deposits you near the front entrance. Lobby was nice and bright, both escalators out of service, and the 4 glass elevators were painfully slow. Room was fair, typical chain hotel bedding and furnishings. My room was obviously not one of the renovated ones. Overall it was confortable. Room service and mini-bar prices expensive; avoid if you can. No free wireless Internet access...$9.99 a day for T-mobile unless you already have an account. In room coffee maker, hair dryer dirty and dusty. My bedspread had some weird blood-spray looking stains on it...weird. Noisy hallways, and they started construction at 8am. Not good for sleeping in. Soda machines mostly all sold out. Bistro 300 was fair...not a good value for the price. Coffee bar/pastries/donuts available. Business center only open during the week. Overpriced on-site gift shop. I got a conference rate for the room, and I wouldn't have been happy to pay full price. My advice: check around for a better deal, unless you want to check out the renovated hotel. Just make sure to wait until it's completed.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: surethngrw
Reviews.Content: Just road-tripped to Baltimore for a weekend on the Inner Harbor. I booked the room for less than 1/2 the advertised price through priceline---. Had i spent full-price, i wouldnt been disappointed, but i felt like i was getting away with something in the first place. The room was just average. Nothing luxurious about it, and nothing worth remembering. I requested king bed/harbor view in advance, and both requests were ignored. Again, i was happy to be staying there, and im the type who makes the best of his situations. What you pay for here is the location, and it was perfect. A quick outdoor skywalk got me everywhere i needed to go...food, entertainment, etc. There's a water-taxi stop right on the water too which will take you anywhere else you need to go. The hotel was adequate, but definitely not a "destination" in and of itself. Just dont pay full-price!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: devilmebettie
Reviews.Content: First of all, they booked me into a corner room that is so small, I could not believe it. I had to call down to have my room moved. I had no hot water to take a shower. There were kids running down the floors constantly, having races, being very loud. The food & Service at the Pisces lounge is TERRIBLE!!! And VERY over priced!! I'll never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worn, Warm and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Paid $120 for two nights over weekend thanks to Priceline. Check-in, check-out very nice and with just a little cajoling (and mentioning the fact that I was a Hyatt rewards card holder - who left his card home!) we were able to get a great harbor view room for no extra charge. The location is very good. The hotel is neat & clean but looking a little worn. The bed was comfortable, the linens nice and the bath was clean and was a pleasure to use. Nothing to rave about, but no complaints. Valet parking is only $5 more a night but in an earlier trip to Baltimore the valet dinged my car on two consecutive days and... it ended up that I never got paid for either one (the valet service is a seperate company from the hotel). So we don't use valet when in Baltimore. The next-door parking is close by and with the hotel pass you can come and go as you please. TIP - for those new to Baltimore, the food in Harborplace across the street is not too good and not too cheap (and we've tried them all!) but Little Italy is a few minutes by car (ask at the desk) and there are plenty of Great Places there. Also, the Hyatt on-site restaurant is good but not great and very pricey,but with a great view. If you aren't counting your pennies you'll like it "okay". We did the Sunday brunch -- good but not destination good. If you don't expect too much, at $120 a night it is well worth it for the location.

Reviews.Title: “needs some work”
Reviews.Author: NBPINVT
Reviews.Content: I agree with previous comments about friendliness of hotel staff, it was a noticeable plus. Location is great, with the skywalks to both the Convention Center and the Harborplace area (note these are uncovered skywalks). The view from the room - great sunrises every morning! Comfy bed, nice linens, plenty of room, well appointed bathroom. BUT it could have been cleaner (hair visible in bathroom) and the walls are thin...you can hear water running, voices, etc. Bistro 300 - we had drinks/dinner one night b/c we were too tired to go out. The small dinner buffet was decent, but there was only one waiter and he was totally maxed out. All in all, this hotel is an unusual mix of nice/comfy and rather low-rent. I was not footing the bill and would not have been happy to pay full price for this hotel. I would return - for business only. Other folks staying in nearby hotels were also not pleased, so I am not sure what the deal is!

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently Located, but.....”
Reviews.Author: Morena36
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt for eight days in January, and we found most of the employees to be extremely friendly and helpful. Just about every employee acknowledged us in passing by wishing us a good day or just saying "hello." When we arrived, the staff quickly located the items that my husband had shipped to the hotel via UPS days earlier. All of the bell men were friendly and seemed to genuinely enjoy their jobs. The only issues we had were with the room and the rude staff in the Bistro. Our sheets AND blanket were ripped. We had to ask them twice to provide us with new bedding. We thought we could live with the ripped blanket if they would just give us new sheets. After a night of waking up multiple times with the ribbing of the blanket wrapped around either my neck or one of my arms (no...I'm not kidding), I couldn't take it anymore. We also had a rather unpleasant experience during breakfast at the Bistro (the restaurant on the 2nd floor). The servers were rude and one of the cooks actually approached our table and asked my husband if he had a problem because he thought my husband was staring at him from across the room. That was the last time we had a meal in the hotel. We decided that we won't be staying at the Hyatt when we return in January '06. While most of the staff seemed to give 110%, that experience in the restaurant left us with a bad taste in our mouths.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of the Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want a great view of the harbor, then the Hyatt Regency is just for you. The view is amazing both in the daytime and at night. Some of the sights that you’ll see include the aquarium, the Rusty Scupper Restaurant, and the USS Constellation. The rooms are very clean and the staff is friendly and helpful. One of the perks is that Harbor Place is a short walk from the hotel. There is a walkway that connects the hotel to the mall so crossing Light Street is a breeze. Because of the great location, you pretty much have everything the Inner Harbor has to offer right at your fingertips. The Hyatt also has a restaurant, Bistro 300, located right inside. It is very convenient and has an excellent breakfast selection. This hotel is definitely my favorite hotel on the Inner Harbor. I’ve stayed there several times, and I’ve never had a complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: traveler20001
Reviews.Content: I rented a room at the Hyatt to celebrate the "one year" anniversary of dating my partner and was pretty disappointed. Staff: Checkin was acceptable, as was housekeeping when I pointed out the room was lacking bathrobes. Housekeeping in fact came twice with bathrobes after I called. Liked being called by my last name, nice touch. The Concierge desk was disappointing. We asked how to get to the theatre, and with his knee up on the desk, suggested we take a cab. We did take a cab there, but quickly learned it was quite easily within walking distance. Room: Was told there was no way to ensure a "room with a view" unless I sprung for a "suite" on the "Club Level", which I did. Getting to the "suite" took approximately five minutes as the elevators (while beautifully windowed on one side) are miserably slow. Our "suite" is in quotes as it was an unusually small room (~300 square feet). The bed was advertised as a king but was a full, which was fine, but fix the advertising, Hyatt. The "room with a view" was a view of the Bank of America building. Impressive, yes, of the harbor, no. Amenities: The "Club" room to which guests have access was eerily small and empty. It offers a continental breakfast and hors d'oeuvers but we avoided it. The bar downstairs looked quite nice, but we didn't end up stopping by. The pool is a puddle, quite literally. This was perhaps the greatest disappointment. It is a small square, ranges from 3-5 feet deep, and was packed to the sides with children. My partner and I were hoping for a leisurely swim, but it was absolutely not to be. We went to "Pisces" after the theatre, which is the rooftop restaurant. There was unfortunately a wedding party there; very sweet, but very loud. We were luckily able to get a table on the opposite side but still with a beautiful view of the harbor -- that for which I thought I had paid in the "suite". Parking was $20 overnight. Overall: Overpriced for services offered. Has damaged the "Hyatt" brand in my mind. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Otakon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter for Otakon last year and it was a wonderful hotel. I am staying again this year. It was clean and we had a beautiful view.

HotelInfo.Name: Hyatt Regency Baltimore
HotelInfo.Address: 300 Light St., Baltimore, MD 21202
